200.description: Authorizes certain persons to act on behalf of ward before guardian is appointed; prohibits selling or transferring another person's DNA sample for DNA analysis; revises exemptions from prosecution of certain crimes related to unlawful use of DNA samples, DNA analyses, or results of DNA analyses; authorizes health care practitioners & providers to obtain verbal parental consent for provision of health care services, medical procedures, & prescription of medicinal drugs to minor child; requires health care practitioners & providers to document certain information when written parental consent is not obtained.

201.title: Motor Vehicle Insurance
201.description: Repeals Florida Motor Vehicle No-Fault Law; revises motor vehicle insurance coverages; revises garage liability insurance requirements; provides that driver license or motor vehicle registration suspensions for failure to maintain required security remain in full force & effect; revises amount of certificate of deposit required to elect certain method of proof of financial responsibility; revises minimum net worth requirements to qualify certain persons as self-insurers; revises grounds for discipline for certain health professions; specifies coverage options that insurer is required & authorized to offer; prohibits insurer providing medical payments coverage benefits from seeking lien on certain recovery & bringing certain cause of action; authorizes insurers to include policy provisions allowing for subrogation, for medical payments benefits paid; prohibits insurers from including policy provisions allowing for subrogation for death benefits paid; revises legal liability of uninsured motorist coverage insurer; requires motor vehicle insurance policies to provide death benefits.

202.title: Solicitation of Minors to Commit Lewd or Lascivious Acts
202.description: Prohibits person 24 years of age or older from soliciting person 16 or 17 years old in writing to commit lewd or lascivious act.

203.title: False Personation
203.description: Prohibits doing certain acts with specified intent while falsely personating another.

204.title: Newborn Hearing Screenings
204.description: Defines term "congenital cytomegalovirus test"; revises newborn hearing screening requirements to require that all newborns, rather than only those who fail the initial newborn hearing screening, be tested for congenital cytomegalovirus.

205.last_action: Added to Regulatory Reform & Economic Development Subcommittee agenda
205.title: Homeowners' Right to Display Flags
205.description: Authorizes homeowners to display no more than certain number of flags regardless of prohibitions in governing documents of homeowners' association; prohibits homeowners' association documents from precluding property owners from displaying certain number of specified flags.

206.title: Land Use and Development Regulations
206.description: Provides types of relief that may be included in negotiated settlement; requires special magistrate to consider public interest served by comprehensive plan provisions that are inconsistent with proposed relief; revises elements that must be included in comprehensive plan; revises frequency at which local government must evaluate its comprehensive plan; prohibits local government from publicly initiating or adopting plan amendments to its comprehensive plan when it fails to meet certain requirements; revises exceptions to applicability of land development regulations relating to single-family or two-family dwelling building design elements.

207.title: Removal of Unknown Parties in Possession
207.description: Revises requirements for service on unknown parties in possession.

209.title: Certificates of Completion
209.description: Prohibits award of certificates of completion after specified date.

210.title: Child Care Facilities Exempt from Licensing
210.description: Exempts child care facility licensed by branch of United States Department of Defense or United States Coast Guard from certain state licensing requirements.

211.title: AMIkids, Inc.
211.description: Authorizes DJJ, DOE & DCF to contract with AMIkids, Inc., for specified services.

212.title: Valuation of Timeshare Units
212.description: Specifies methodology by which certain timeshare units must be valued in certain tax appeals; provides that methodology meets constitutional mandate for just valuation.

213.title: Veterans' Assistance Grants
213.description: Requires DVA, subject to appropriation, to award grants to certain entities for purpose of increasing public awareness of benefits & services available to veterans; provides requirements for initial grant recipients; requires report to DVA as condition for consideration for subsequent grants; requires DVA to adopt rules.

214.title: Career-themed Courses
214.description: Revises requirements for specified school district strategic plan & annual DOE review of K-12 & postsecondary career & technical education offerings; & requires school districts to inform students & parents of specified information during middle school course selection.

215.title: Construction of Educational Plant Space
215.description: Provides certain school district construction projects are exempt from cost per student station requirements.

217.title: Apprenticeship and Preapprenticeship Direct Funding Grant Program
217.description: Creates Apprenticeship and Preapprenticeship Direct Funding Grant Program for specified purposes; requires DOE to administer program; provides requirements for such program.

218.title: Groveland Four Business Loans and Scholarships
218.description: Requires DEO to prioritize applications for Black Business Loan Program; creates Groveland Four Scholarship Program & provides requirements for program.

219.last_action: Now in Higher Education Appropriations Subcommittee
219.title: Workforce Education
219.description: Prohibits institutions from imposing additional criteria to determine student eligibility for Open Door Grant Program; revises student eligibility requirements; & increases amount DOE may reimburse institution through program for completed workforce training program.

220.title: Anti-drug Instruction in Public Schools
220.description: Requires each school district to provide anti-drug instruction to certain students; provides requirements for instruction; requires DOE to develop or procure curriculum for such instruction; provides requirements for delivery of instruction; provides for funding for curriculum & instruction.

221.last_action: Now in Local Administration, Federal Affairs & Special Districts Subcommittee
221.title: Homestead Assessments
221.description: Revises limitation on annual increases of homestead property tax assessments.

222.title: Agreement for Best Practices in Economic Development
222.description: Creates Agreement for Best Practices in Economic Development; establishes National Board for Best Practices in Economic Development; requires board to publish specified material regarding best practices in economic development & suggest annual revisions; requires board to accept testimony related to economic development improvements; prohibits member states from offering or providing company-specific tax incentives or company-specific grants for specified purposes; provides procedures for withdrawing from agreement.

223.title: Residential Graywater System Tax Credits
223.description: Provides tax credit to developers & homebuilders for certain graywater purchased during taxable year; provides cap on amount of tax credit per system; specifies information developer or homebuilder must provide to DOR; authorizes tax credits to be carried forward.

224.title: Term Limits for District School Board Members
224.description: Revises term limits for district school board members.

225.title: Required Instruction in History of Holocaust and History of African Americans
225.description: Revises provisions relating to required instruction in history of African Americans; requires department to annually verify that school districts, charter schools, & specified private schools implement certain instruction relating to history of Holocaust & history of African Americans; requires district school superintendents, charter school principals, & private school directors or similar administrators to annually provide specified evidence to department by certain date; provides penalties; & requires certain statewide, standardized assessments to include curricula content from history of Holocaust & history of African Americans.

226.title: Physician Assistants' Prescriptive Authority
226.description: Removes requirements that physician assistants may only prescribe or dispense drugs under physician's supervision.

227.title: Blood Clot and Pulmonary Embolism Policy Workgroup
227.description: Requires Secretary of Health Care Administration, in conjunction with State Surgeon General, to establish blood clot & pulmonary embolism policy workgroup; provides for duties, membership, terms of office, & meetings of workgroup; requires Secretary of Health Care Administration to submit annual reports, & final report by specified date, to Governor & Legislature.

228.last_action: Now in Health Care Appropriations Subcommittee
228.title: Veterans' Services and Recognition
228.description: Creates Division of Long-term Care; revises qualifications for county & city veteran service officers; creates "Veterans' Adult Day Health Care of Florida Act"; provides purpose & definitions; provides for appointment, qualifications, duties, & responsibilities of program operator; establishes nondiscrimination policy; provides program admittance eligibility & priority; provides for audits, inspections, & operational standards; designates "Veterans Week."

229.last_action: Favorable with CS by Insurance & Banking Subcommittee
229.title: Department of Financial Services
229.description: Removes provisions prohibiting individuals holding specified insurance licenses from holding certain other insurance licenses; provides disposition of funds received by title insurance agencies & funds required to be maintained in escrow trust accounts; exempts appointed public adjusters from certain insurance activities' prohibitions; requires navigators' registrations to expire under certain circumstances; prohibits insurers & insurance agents from engaging in specified practices relating to collateral protection property insurance; removes certain financial requirements for warranty associations & parent corporations; prohibits department from issuing temporary bail bond agent's licenses; specifies procedures for remission of forfeitures of deceased defendants; specifies procedures for remission of forfeitures of defendants for whom state is unwilling to seek extradition.

230.title: Professional Licensing Requirements for Barbers and Cosmetologists
230.description: Provides period of time when conviction, or any other adjudication, for crime may not be grounds for denial of licensure as barber or cosmetologist; requires applicable board to approve educational program credits offered to inmates in institutions or facilities for purposes of satisfying training requirements for licensure as barber or cosmetologist.

231.title: Assignment for the Benefit of Creditors
231.description: Revises requirements for commencement of proceedings for general assignments; provides courts with judicial discretion to determine compliance; provides for assignee's ability to rely on, & defense for good faith compliance with, court orders, judgments, decrees, & rules of law; establishes nonliability of assignee when certain requirements are met; limits assets creditor or other party in interest may pursue in action against assignee; excludes creditors from being required to turn over assets of estate upon notice of assignment action or proceeding; requires negative notice in assignment action by assignee upon filing of notice of rejection.

232.title: Applicants for Licensure as a Medical Marijuana Treatment Center
232.description: Authorizes joint venture partner of specified applicants to be licensed as medical marijuana treatment center & receive maximum points for its diversity plan; requires DOH to license specified applicants that are recognized class members of specified class actions; provides rights of such recognized class members inures to its successors or assignees; authorizes applicant for licensure as medical marijuana treatment center to demonstrate that applicant has maintained bona fide business in agriculture industry before submitting application.

233.title: Commission on Public Safety in Urban and Inner-City Communities
233.description: Creates Commission on Public Safety in Urban and Inner-City Communities; provides for membership & staff support; provides requirements for meetings; specifies duties; provides for powers; authorizes commission to access certain exempt or confidential & exempt information or records; requires reports; provides for sunset of commission.

234.title: Pub. Meetings/Commission on Public Safety in Urban and Inner-City Communities
234.description: Provides exemption from public meetings requirements for portions of meetings of Commission on Public Safety in Urban and Inner-City Communities at which exempt or confidential & exempt information is discussed; provides for future legislative review & repeal; provides statement of public necessity.

235.title: Florida Main Street Program and Historic Preservation Tax Credits
235.description: Specifies eligibility requirements for receiving specified tax credits for taxpayers that rehabilitate certified historic structures; specifies requirements for taxpayers claiming or transferring specified tax credits; specifies requirements for Division of Historical Resources of DOS for evaluating & certifying applications for specified tax credits; specifies amount of tax credits; authorizes carryforward, sale, & transfer of tax credits; revises order in which tax credits against corporate income tax credit or franchise tax are applied; revises order in which credits & deductions against insurance premium tax are applied.

236.title: Restoration of Voting Rights Information on Sentencing Scoresheets
236.description: Specifies information to be provide on sentencing scoresheets concerning restoration of voting rights; requires scoresheet to be provided to defendant before sentence is imposed.

237.title: Practice of Dentistry
237.description: Requires dentists & individuals & entities that provide dental services through telehealth to provide each patient with specified information; requires that there be dentist of record for each patient treated through telehealth; requires that advertisements of specified dental services provided through telehealth contain specified disclaimer; prohibits individuals & entities that provide dental services through telehealth from requiring patient to sign agreement containing certain provisions; specifies that only certain dental practitioners may perform specified functions of dentistry; provides additional grounds for disciplinary action against dental practitioners.

238.title: Insurance
238.description: Revises requirements for residential property insurance rate filings; authorizes appointment of certain designees to Florida Commission on Hurricane Loss Projection Methodology; authorizes insurers to file with OIR personal lines residential property insurance rating plans relating to windstorm mitigation construction standards; revises timeframe for notices from insurers to insureds of automatic bank withdrawal increases; specifies increase threshold for such notices; authorizes electronic delivery of insurance policy documents for certain health insurance policies, certificates of coverage, & contracts; eliminating requirements for paper delivery of certain insurance policies; authorizes insurance policyholders to type intent to decline certain coverage instead of handwriting it; revises requirements for notice of certain automobile policies.

239.title: Federal Taxation
239.description: Authorizes CFO to reimburse owner of small business attorney fees & costs from Internal Revenue Service Civil Liability Trust Fund under certain conditions; requires DFS to certify information before such reimbursement; provides for action in circuit court for award of attorney fees & costs, actual damages, & punitive damages when IRS is found to have committed certain violations; provides payment settlement entity is only required to issue return to certain participating payees; requires payment settlement entity to create & maintain certain records; requires report submitted by financial institution to FSC to include information received from IRS; requires OFR to submit annual report.

240.title: Trust Funds/Internal Revenue Service Civil Liability Trust Fund/DFS
240.description: Creates Internal Revenue Service Civil Liability Trust Fund within DFS; provides sources of funds; specifies purpose of trust fund; exempts trust fund from termination.

241.title: Eligibility for Medical Assistance and Related Services
241.description: Extends Medicaid eligibility to specified adults.

242.last_action: Added to Postsecondary Education & Workforce Subcommittee agenda
242.title: Office of Inspector General of the Board of Governors of the State University System
242.description: Authorizes OIG to issue & serve subpoenas duces tecum for specified purposes & require or permit certain persons to file specified statements; authorizes OIG to petition certain courts for specified purposes.

243.title: Nursing Education for Military Combat Medics
243.description: Revising a primary goal of the Florida Center for Nursing to provide that development of a statewide plan for nursing manpower must include the encouragement and coordination of the development of partnerships with hospitals which provide opportunities for nursing students to obtain clinical experience; requiring that the Articulation Coordinating Committee convene a workgroup to establish a process for determining postsecondary course equivalencies and the minimum postsecondary credit or career education clock hours that must be awarded in accredited nursing education programs for military training and education required for service in specified positions; authorizing the award of additional postsecondary credit or career education clock hours.

244.title: Preemption of the Regulation of Tobacco and Nicotine Products
244.description: Repeals provisions relating to preemption of regulation of tobacco & nicotine products.

245.title: Time Limitations for Prosecution of Certain Sexual Offenses
245.description: Revises time periods for prosecution of specified sexual offenses committed on certain victims in certain circumstances.

246.last_action: Added to Regulatory Reform & Economic Development Subcommittee agenda
246.title: Individual Wine Containers
246.description: Repeals provisions relating to limitation of size of individual wine containers.

247.title: Pub. Rec./County and City Attorneys
247.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying & location information of current county attorneys, assistant county attorneys, deputy county attorneys, city attorneys, assistant city attorneys, & deputy city attorneys & names & personal identifying & location information of spouses & children of such attorneys; provides for future legislative review & repeal; provides statement of public necessity.

248.title: Office of the Blue Economy
248.description: Establishes Office of the Blue Economy within DEO; provides duties of office; requires EDR to conduct biennial evaluation of blue economy for inclusion in certain assessment.

249.title: Natural Gas Fuel Taxes
249.description: Extends expiration date for levying penalties on natural gas retailers that do not have licenses; delaying effective date of certain taxes on natural gas fuel.

250.title: Fair Repair of Agricultural Equipment
250.description: Requires original equipment manufacturers of agricultural equipment to provide certain manufacturing, diagnostic, & repair information to independent repair providers & owners; prohibits original equipment manufacturers from excluding certain information concerning security-related functions; provides civil liability.

251.title: Law Enforcement Officer Funeral Service Benefits
251.description: Authorizes certain number of hours of administrative leave be granted to members of law enforcement agency for specified purpose; authorizes head of law enforcement agency to deny such administrative leave; authorizes travel expenses to members of law enforcement agency for specified purpose; increases amount of money to be paid toward funeral & burial expenses for officers killed in line of duty; authorizes use of state motor vehicle to attend funeral in state of law enforcement officer killed in line of duty.

252.title: Custody and Supervision of Specified Offenders
252.description: Excludes certain offenders from eligibility to receive basic gain-time & incentive gain-time; excludes certain offenders from eligibility for specified reductions to term of supervision; requires court to impose additional conditions of supervision on specified offenders.

253.last_action: Added to Civil Justice Subcommittee agenda
253.title: Motor Vehicle Glass
253.description: Prohibits motor vehicle repair shops from offering anything of value to customer in exchange for making insurance claim for motor vehicle glass replacement or repair; specifies that failure to provide certain electronic or written notice relating to calibrating or recalibrating advanced driver assistance system is unlawful; authorizes optional deductible for windshield glass; specifies deductible amount; limits deductible application; prohibits persons from entering into assignment agreements of post-loss benefits for motor vehicle glass replacement or repair; provides that such assignment agreements are void & unenforceable.

254.title: Public Safety
254.description: Authorizes person to carry concealed weapon or firearm if he or she is licensed to do so or meets specified requirements; requires person who is carrying concealed weapon or firearm without license to carry identification & display upon demand by law enforcement; prohibits person who is carrying concealed weapon or firearm without license from carrying such weapon or firearm in specified locations; authorizes nonresident to carry concealed weapon or firearm in this state if he or she meets same requirements as resident; requires Office of Safe Schools to develop behavioral threat management operational process.

255.last_action: Added to Regulatory Reform & Economic Development Subcommittee agenda
255.title: Fines Levied by Homeowners' Associations
255.description: Prohibits fines imposed by homeowners' associations to exceed $500 in aggregate.

257.title: Operating Vehicles and Vessels Under the Influence
257.description: Revises conditions under which person commits offense of driving under influence or boating under influence; provides affirmative defense; revises condition that must be met before person arrested for driving under influence or boating under influence, respectively, may be released from custody; specified grounds for issuance of search warrant.

258.title: Required African-American Instruction
258.description: Requires each school district to certify & provide certain evidence to DOE regarding certain instruction; authorizes DOE to seek input from & contract with certain educational organizations for specified purposes; requires each school district to submit implementation plan to Commissioner of Education & post plan on its website; provides requirements for plan; requires commissioner or DOE to provide certain notification; provides timeframe within which school district must submit revisions to its plan; authorizes SBE to take certain actions.

259.title: State Recognition of Indian Tribes and Bands
259.description: Provides for state recognition of specified Indian tribes & bands; authorizes Indian tribes & bands to petition Secretary of State for state recognition; authorizes Secretary of State to review petitions & make recommendations to Legislature; requires Secretary of State to consider certain factors when making recommendations.

260.title: Sentencing Proceedings in Death Penalty Cases
260.description: Specifies that jury recommends sentence of death if at least 8 jurors determine sentence of death is appropriate; specifies that jury recommends sentence of life imprisonment without possibility of parole if fewer than 8 jurors determine sentence of death is appropriate; requires court to sentence defendant as recommended by jury; requires court to set forth specified written findings if it imposes sentence of death in specified cases.

262.title: Land Acquisition Funding
262.description: Extends retirement date of bonds issues to fund Florida Forever Act; revises distribution of proceeds from Florida Forever Trust Fund for land acquisition & capital project expenditures under Florida Forever Act; requires specified annual appropriation to Florida Forever Trust Fund; prohibits use of moneys from Land Acquisition Trust Fund for specified costs.

263.title: Mangrove Replanting and Restoration
263.description: Requires DEP to adopt certain rules for mangrove replanting & restoration.

264.title: Prohibited Applications on Government-issued Devices
264.description: Requires public employers to take certain actions relating to prohibited applications; prohibits downloading or accessing prohibited applications on government-issued devices; provides deadline by which specified employees must remove, delete, or uninstall prohibited application; requires DMS to compile & maintain specified list & establish procedures for specified waiver.

265.last_action: Bill added to Special Order Calendar (3/30/2023)
265.title: Lake Padgett Estates Independent Special District, Pasco County
265.description: Revises terms of certain members elected to board of supervisors to provide for staggered terms.

266.title: Pretrial Detention
266.description: Adds additional offenses to definition of "dangerous crime" for purposes of determining pretrial release eligibility.

268.title: Costs of Supervision or Care of Children
268.description: Removes provisions for fee for costs of care or supervision of certain children & for assessment & collection of such fees; provides such fees may not be ordered, balances owed for such fees may not be collected, unpaid civil judgments for such fees are void & unenforceable, warrants issued solely based on alleged failure to pay such fees are void & any person whose driver license was suspended for failure to pay such fees shall be eligible for reinstatement.

269.title: Coverage for Diagnostic and Supplemental Breast Examinations
269.description: Prohibits state group insurance program from imposing any enrollee cost-sharing liability with respect to coverage for diagnostic breast examinations & supplemental breast examinations; prohibits imposition of cost-sharing requirements for diagnostic & supplemental breast examinations by individual accident & health insurance policies; group, blanket, & franchise accident or health insurance policies; & health maintenance contracts, which provide such coverage.

270.title: Teacher Certification Fees
270.description: Requires SBE to waive certain fees relating to teacher certifications for specified time period.

271.title: Assault Weapons and Large-capacity Magazines
271.description: Prohibits sale, transfer, or possession of assault weapon or large-capacity magazine; requires certificates of possession for assault weapons or large-capacity magazines lawfully possessed before specified date; limits sales or transfers of assault weapons or large-capacity magazines documented by such certificates; provides enhanced penalties for offenses committed with assault weapon or large-capacity magazine.

272.title: Health Care Practitioner Titles and Abbreviations
272.description: Defines "advertisement" & "deceptive or misleading terms or false representation"; specifies which titles & abbreviations health care practitioners may use in their advertisements, communications, & personal identification; requires health care practitioners to disclose specified information & use only authorized titles & abbreviations in their advertisements; prohibits health care practitioners from using deceptive or misleading terms or false representations in their advertisements; provides for denial of licensure & disciplinary action.

273.title: Instructions on Emergency First Aid for Choking
273.description: Requires poster containing specified information relating to choking to be placed in public school cafeterias; & provides requirements for placement of such posters.

274.title: Protection from Surgical Smoke
274.description: Requiring hospitals & ambulatory surgical centers to adopt & implement policies requiring use of smoke evacuation systems during certain surgical procedures.

275.title: Task Force on Workforce Housing for Teachers and Expansion of Schools
275.description: Creates task force adjunct to DEO; provides for membership, duties, & responsibilities of taskforce; requires state agencies to assist & cooperate with task force; encouraging local governments to assist & cooperate with task force.

276.last_action: Added to Choice & Innovation Subcommittee agenda
276.title: Social Media Protection for Minors
276.description: Requires social media platforms to disclose specified policies & provide specified resources, measures, & disclaimers; authorizes social media platforms to post specified compliance statements on their Internet homepage or platform user login page; prohibits certain schools from using or having account on certain social media platforms & from requiring students to register, enroll, or participate in social media platforms for educational purposes.

277.last_action: Now in Ethics, Elections & Open Government Subcommittee
277.title: Automatic Sealing of Criminal History Records
277.description: Requires court to automatically seal certain criminal history records that meet specified criteria; requires clerk of court to seal certain criminal history records.

278.title: Determination of Residential Status for Tuition Purposes
278.description: Revises requirements for person to be considered resident for tuition purposes to include time spent in certain correctional institutions.

279.title: Operation of Electric Bicycles and Motorized Scooters
279.description: Authorizes violation relating to operation of certain electric bicycles or motorized scooters to be punishable as provided in local government ordinance; limits amount of fine authorized for such violation; authorizes local government to adopt ordinance relating to operation of certain electric bicycles or motorized scooters in order to protect public; requires local government to provide certain notice of adoption & enforcement of such ordinance.

280.title: Debt Management Services
280.description: Increases maximum fee that may be charged for debt management services.

281.title: Referral of Patients by Health Care Providers
281.description: Removes definition of terms "direct supervision" & "present in office suite"; revises definition of term "referral" to remove direct physician supervision & to require compliance with certain Medicare payments & rules.

282.title: Exploitation of Vulnerable Persons
282.description: Specifies conditions under which person commits exploitation of person 65 years of age or older; provides for advancing certain trials on docket; authorizes persons who are in imminent danger of exploitation to petition for protective injunction; provides time limitations for prosecution for violations; provides exception.

283.title: Expunction of Criminal History Records
283.description: Revises eligibility criterion under which person is eligible to petition court to expunge criminal history record if charging document was dismissed by court; expands exception to eligibility requirement for expunction of criminal history record to allow prior expunction of criminal history record granted for an offense committed when person was minor.

284.title: Money Services Businesses
284.description: Revises definition of term "control person" for purposes of ch. 560, F.S.; defines "governing documents."

285.title: Sentencing for Capital Felonies
285.description: Authorizes court to impose jury's recommended sentence of life imprisonment without possibility of parole for certain capital felonies; requires court to enter written order addressing sentence of life imprisonment without possibility of parole & include in its required written order reasons for not accepting jury's recommended sentence, if applicable.

286.title: Bonds of Contractors Constructing Public Buildings
286.description: Exempts certain contractors from executing payment & performance bonds when certain criteria are met.

287.title: Deferred Retirement Option Program for Correctional Officers
287.description: Authorizes certain members to participate in DROP for additional time.

288.title: Illicit Massage Establishments
288.description: Authorizes officers to perform inspections & investigations; prohibits sexual activity in establishments; provides requirements for outside windows & signs, advertising, operating hours, employee dress code, displaying employee information & photos, collecting certain customer & patient information; prohibits establishments from sheltering or harboring, or being used as sleeping quarters for any person; specifies activities that constitute sexual misconduct in practice of massage therapy; provides criminal penalties; provides for summary suspension of licenses.

289.title: Private Property for Motor Vehicle Parking
289.description: Requires invoices for parking charges be sent by certified mail to specified party; prohibits late fees before certain period; authorizes late fees after such period; prohibits county or municipality from adopting certain ordinance or regulation; prohibits private property owner or operator from charging specified parties under certain conditions.

290.title: State Estate Tax
290.description: Provides exceptions relating to state estate tax for certain estates.

291.title: Death Benefits for Active Duty Servicemembers
291.description: Revises amount & conditions of payment of death benefits; requires payment be made to beneficiary through process set out by DMA; removes provisions relating to payment when beneficiary is not designated; requires proof of residency or duty post to be provided to DMA; requires DMA to request CFO to draw warrant for payment of benefits from General Revenue Fund; removes provisions relating to appropriation to DFS for payment of death benefits.

292.title: Determination of Full-time Equivalent Membership for Florida Education Finance Program
292.description: Requires minimum number of membership surveys be conducted annually for FEFP.

293.last_action: Added to Children, Families & Seniors Subcommittee agenda
293.title: Children's Initiative Projects
293.description: Creates Mercy Drive Kidz Zone & Englewood Kidz Zone in City of Orlando, Orange County; requires projects to be managed by nonprofit corporations; exempts projects from control, supervision, or direction by any state department; subjects corporations to requirements relating to public records & meetings & procurement of commodities & contractual services; provides for implementation.

294.last_action: Laid on Table, refer to CS/SB 102
294.title: Housing
294.description: Removes authority of local governments to adopt or maintain laws, ordinances, rules, or other measures that would have effect of imposing controls on rents; specifies requirements & restrictions on counties in approving housing developments; authorizes local governments to adopt ordinances to provide ad valorem tax exemption for portions of property used to provide affordable housing; revises total amount of community contribution tax credits which may be granted for projects; provides sales tax exemption for building materials used in construction of affordable housing units; authorizes department to make information available to corporation to administer Live Local Program; prohibits deduction of General Revenue Fund service charge on documentary stamp tax proceeds; provides appropriations.

295.title: Victims of Reform School Abuse
295.description: Requires person seeking certification as victim of Florida reform school abuse to apply to DOS by specified date; authorizes specified persons to apply on behalf of decedent; requires DOS to review & process completed application within certain timeframe; prohibits DOS from denying an application for specified reasons; requires DOS to submit list of certified victims to Legislature; provides exceptions from specified requirements for crime victim compensation eligibility for victims.

296.title: Pub. Rec./Reform School Abuse Victims
296.description: Provides an exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying information in applications submitted to DOS by persons seeking certification as victims of Florida reform school abuse; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

297.title: K-12 Education
297.description: Removes specified reduction calculation for certain school district funding for school districts that fail to meet certain class size requirements; provides that certain dependent children of active duty military personnel must be enrolled in certain programs; & authorizes certain students of military personnel to enroll in any school within state.

298.last_action: Now in Health Care Appropriations Subcommittee
298.title: Dental Services for Veterans
298.description: Establishes Veterans Dental Care Grant Program within DVA; specifies purpose of program; requires DVA to contract with direct-support organization to administer program; provides program funding is subject to legislative appropriation.

299.last_action: Added to Civil Justice Subcommittee agenda
299.title: Motor Vehicle Dealers, Manufacturers, Importers, and Distributors
299.description: Prohibits manufacturer, distributor, or importer from certain actions in allocation or distribution to franchised motor vehicle dealers; authorizes sale or activation of accessories or features through remote electronic transmission; revises provisions prohibiting manufacturer, distributor, or importer from owning, operating, or controlling motor vehicle dealership; authorizes application for injunction; authorizes motor vehicle dealer association to seek declaration & adjudication of rights with respect to certain violations.

300.last_action: Added to Regulatory Reform & Economic Development Subcommittee agenda
300.title: Issuance of Special Beverage Licenses
300.description: Revises requirements for issuing special beverage licenses to certain food service establishments.

301.last_action: Added to Infrastructure Strategies Committee agenda
301.title: Restoration of Osborne Reef
301.description: Requires DEP to submit status report on Osborne Reef cleanup & tire removal project to Legislature & to develop reef restoration plan & submit report on plan to Legislature.

302.last_action: Added to Infrastructure & Tourism Appropriations Subcommittee agenda
302.title: Library Cooperative Funding
302.description: Authorizes administrative unit of library cooperative to receive annual appropriation, instead of limited grant from state, for certain purpose.

303.last_action: Added to Infrastructure Strategies Committee agenda
303.title: Unmanned Aircraft Systems Act
303.description: Removes provision requiring certain persons & governmental entities to apply to FAA to restrict or limit operation of drones in close proximity to certain infrastructure or facilities; removes provision allowing drone operating in transit for commercial purposes to operate over critical infrastructure facility; provides for future sunset of definition of "critical infrastructure facility."

304.title: Trust Funds/Trust Fund for Victims of Human Trafficking/DLA
304.description: Creates Trust Fund for Victims of Human Trafficking within DLA; provides for funding sources & purposes of trust fund; provides for future review & termination or re-creation of trust fund.

305.title: Trust Fund for Victims of Human Trafficking
305.description: Specifies authorized uses of funds from Trust Fund for Victims of Human Trafficking.

306.title: Human Trafficking
306.description: Revises criminal penalties to include fines of certain amounts; requires prosecution of specified offenses under Florida RICO; requires DOE & DOH, in conjunction with Statewide Council on Human Trafficking, to establish an awareness training program; requires each state attorney to ensure prosecutors receive certain mandatory training; requires each state attorney to adopt pro-prosecution policy for human trafficking offenses.

307.last_action: Now in Ethics, Elections & Open Government Subcommittee
307.title: Municipal Annexation and Contraction

308.last_action: Favorable with CS by Health & Human Services Committee
308.title: Suicide Prevention
308.description: Renames Commission on Mental Health & Substance Abuse; revises purposes of commission to include assessment of state's suicide prevention infrastructure; revises duties of commission to include duties relating to state's suicide prevention infrastructure; requires commission to submit annual interim reports for specified timeframe; revises date by which commission must submit its final report; extends repeal date of commission.

309.last_action: Added to Justice Appropriations Subcommittee agenda
309.title: Enforcement of School Zone Speed Limits
309.description: Authorizes county or municipality to enforce speed limit in school zone through speed detection system; requires DOT to establish specifications; requires notice to public; requires law enforcement agency to administer School Crossing Guard Recruitment & Retention Program; provides for issuance of traffic citations by traffic infraction enforcement officer; provides notification requirements & procedures; provides photographs or video & evidence of speed are admissible in proceedings; requires reports; requires law enforcement agency to maintain log & perform tests of speed detection systems; provides penalty for speed limit violation in school zone; prohibits points from being imposed against driver license; prohibits infractions from being used to set insurance rates.

310.title: Sexually Transmissible Diseases
310.description: Reduces degree of criminal penalty for certain persons infected with HIV & who donate blood, plasma, organs, skin, or other human tissue for use in another person; revises prohibitions relating to intentional transmission of certain diseases through sexual conduct; revises penalties; revises requirements for HIV testing in cases involving criminal transmission of HIV.

311.title: Sanitary Sewer Lateral Inspection Programs
311.description: Authorizes counties & municipalities to access sanitary sewer mainlines within or outside its jurisdiction for specified purposes; authorizes counties & municipalities to access sanitary sewer laterals within their jurisdictions for specified purposes; requires counties & municipalities to provide specified notice to private property owners, issue certain permits, & assume certain legal & financial responsibility; authorizes counties & municipalities to use certain state & local funds for specified purposes.

312.title: Employee Leave and Wage and Salary History
312.description: Authorizes parental leave for state employees in Career Service System whose child is stillborn; prohibits public employer, employment agency, & private employer from engaging in certain activities relating to wages & salary; authorizes public employer, employment agency, & private employer to confirm prospective employee's wage & salary history under certain conditions.

313.title: Workforce Housing Communities
313.description: Authorizes governmental entities to create workforce housing communities by creating HOAs & entering into contracts with infrastructure services companies; provides requirements for governing documents, monthly assessments, certain logs & disclosures & residents; provides for procurement, installation, & maintenance of major components of workforce housing units; requires remaining construction costs be paid for with resident provided capital; requires that certain major components be excluded from purchase transaction; authorizes certain costs to be deducted from gross proceeds of sale.

314.title: Duty of Candor to Alleged Victims
314.description: Requires certain persons to disclose their identity and, if representing or working on behalf of another, identity of that other person & his or her relation to that person when contacting alleged victim of crime or delinquent act to obtain information relating to alleged victim or crime or delinquent act; provides criminal penalties.

315.title: Resiliency Energy Environment Florida Programs
315.description: Provides that property owner may apply to Resiliency Energy Environment Florida (REEF) program for funding to finance qualifying improvement & may enter into assessment financing agreement with local government; provides REEF program costs may be collected as non-ad valorem assessments; authorizes local government to enter into agreement with program administrator to administer REEF program; specifies additional annual reporting requirements for program administrators.

316.last_action: Added to Regulatory Reform & Economic Development Subcommittee agenda
316.title: Residential Building Permits
316.description: Removes provisions relating to acquiring building permits for certain residential dwellings; requires local jurisdiction to reduce permit fees; revises timeframes for approving or denying building permits; specifies when permit application is deemed complete & sufficient; requires opportunity for in-person or virtual meeting before second request for additional information may be made; reduces permit fees if certain timeframes are not met; specifies that permit requirements apply to single-family residential units & single-family residential dwellings; requires that local governments follow prescribed timeframes unless local ordinance is more stringent.

317.title: Central Service Technicians
317.description: Creates Central Service Technicians Act; establishes training certification requirements for central service technicians; requires health care facility to confirm & provide certain information.

318.title: Specialty License Plates
318.description: Directs DHSMV to develop Recycle Florida license plate & Florida Association of Realtors license plate; provides for distribution & use of fees collected from sale of plates.

319.title: Interchange Fees on Taxes
319.description: Requires that certain taxes listed on evidences of sales must be excluded from amount on which interchange fee is charged for that electronic payment transaction; specifies requirements for payment card networks in deducting taxes or rebating amounts; requires merchants & sellers to provide to payment card networks proof of certain tax amounts or sales data within specified timeframe; specifies requirements for payment card networks if merchant or seller is unable to capture & transmit tax amounts relevant to sale at time of sale; provides penalty.

320.title: Agreements of State Colleges and State Universities with Foreign Entities
320.description: Prohibits state universities & state colleges from accepting grants from or participating in partnerships or agreements with foreign country of concern unless specified conditions are met; provides requirements for such colleges & universities to enter into such partnerships or agreements; provides reporting requirements; & prohibits such universities & colleges from soliciting or accepting gift from foreign country of concern.

321.title: Sales Tax Exemption for Certain Investigation and Security Services
321.description: Exempts charges for investigation & personal background check services, security guards & patrol services, & armored car services from sales & use tax.

322.title: Historically Black Colleges and Universities Matching Endowment Scholarship Program
322.description: Establishes Historically Black Colleges & Universities Matching Endowment Scholarship Program within DOE; provides requirements for such program.

323.title: State University Auxiliary Enterprises
323.description: Requires BOG to establish uniform reporting requirements for state university auxiliary enterprises; & provides state university responsibilities relating to auxiliary enterprises.

324.title: Veterans' Preference for Promotion
324.description: Requires state & political subdivisions to give veterans' preference in employment promotion; authorizes waiver of postsecondary educational requirements; requires DVA to adopt rules to ensure veterans' preference in promotion; requires numerically based selection process to be used to determine qualifications for promotion; requires preference in promotion in positions for which numerically based selection process is not used; provides for investigation & administrative hearing of complaint regarding veterans' promotion preference; provides that military retirement on basis of longevity does not disqualify person from veterans' promotion preference.

325.title: Educator Certifications
325.description: Revises provisions relating to educator certifications.

326.last_action: Added to Agriculture, Conservation & Resiliency Subcommittee agenda
326.title: Recycling of Covered Electronic Devices
326.description: Establishes statewide Covered Electronic Device Recovery Program within DEP; authorizes DEP to use specified funds to administer program; specifies requirements for statewide plan for recycling of covered electronic devices; requires counties to submit specified plan for disposal of covered electronic devices by specified date; requires owners or operators of certain facilities to begin disposing of such facilities' covered electronic devices in permitted reclamation facility beginning on specified date; prohibits any person from disposing of covered electronic devices except at permitted reclamation facility beginning on specified dates; provides civil penalties; authorizes such penalties to be waived under certain conditions.

327.title: Administration of the Program of All-inclusive Care for the Elderly
327.description: Deletes provisions requiring AHCA to consult with DEA regarding administration of Program of All-Inclusive Care for Elderly (PACE) & prohibiting more than one PACE organization within specified service area; authorizes AHCA to enter into certain agreements with PACE organizations.

328.title: Determinations for Tax Exemptions
328.description: Revises circumstances under which certain aircraft operations are deemed to serve governmental, municipal, or public purpose or function; provides that certain leasehold interests in governmental property that have been determined to be exempt from ad valorem taxation remain so for duration of lease.

329.title: Workforce Education Facilities Grant Program
329.description: Creates Workforce Education Facilities Grant Program within DOE; & provides requirements for such program.

330.title: Student Online Personal Information Protection
330.description: Prohibits operators from knowingly engaging in specified activities relating to students' covered information; provides exception; specifies duties of operator; provides circumstances under which operator may disclose students' covered information.

331.title: Wrecker and Towing-Storage Operators
331.description: Prohibits exclusion of wrecker operators from wrecker operator system based solely on prior felony conviction; provides lien can only be placed on specified fees; requires towing-storage operator to accept specified payment methods; removes requirements for law enforcement agencies & DHSMV; revises timeframes & service method for notices & sale of vehicles or vessels; requires posting of bond be done in specified manner; restricting imposition of storage charges; revises permissions to inspect vehicle & vessel; provides procedures & requirements for acquiring bond to release liens.

332.last_action: Added to PreK-12 Appropriations Subcommittee agenda
332.title: Early Childhood Music Education Incentive Program
332.description: Renames Early Childhood Music Education Incentive Pilot Program as Early Childhood Music Education Incentive Program; transfers certain duties regarding program's administration from Commissioner of Education to DOE; provides that program funds are subject to legislative appropriation; provides maximum amount of funding school districts may receive per student in program; revises criteria for school district's eligibility to participate in program; removes obsolete provision requiring UF's College of Education to conduct specified evaluation; revises provisions relating to funding; & abrogates scheduled expiration of provisions governing program.

334.title: Form of Candidate Oath
334.description: Revises address that certain candidates must provide on form of candidate oath; revises address that judicial candidates must provide on form of candidate oath.

335.title: Proceeds Funding Motorcycle Safety Education
335.description: Requires portion of Highway Safety Operating Trust Fund proceeds to fund motorcycle driver improvement program administered by specified nonprofit entity; provides program requirements; requires report to Legislature.

336.title: Aircraft Taxes
336.description: Provides maximum tax that may be collected on each aircraft sale & use.

337.last_action: Added to Agriculture, Conservation & Resiliency Subcommittee agenda
337.title: Administrative Procedures and Permitting Process Review
337.description: Revises provisions relating to rule development, notices, public workshops, publication, timeframes, materials incorporated by reference, statements of estimated regulatory costs, adverse impacts on small businesses, public hearings, lower cost regulatory alternatives, & annual regulatory plans; requires agency review of rules & repromulgation of rules that do not require substantive changes; requires DEP & water management districts to conduct review of permitting processes & permit programs.

338.last_action: Added to Regulatory Reform & Economic Development Subcommittee agenda
338.title: Compensation of Lottery Ticket Retailers
338.description: Provides retailer compensation for lottery ticket sales.

339.last_action: Now in Local Administration, Federal Affairs & Special Districts Subcommittee
339.title: Property Tax Exemptions
339.description: Specifies that veterans & surviving spouses are entitled to certain refund; specifies that surviving spouse may choose to transfer certain exemptions.

340.title: Practice of Veterinary Medicine
340.description: Exempts certain out-of-state veterinarians who provide specified services under responsible supervision of veterinarian licensed in this state from certain regulations governing veterinary medical practice; provides supervising licensed veterinarian is responsible for such services; specifies that such out-of-state veterinarians are ineligible for premises permit.

341.title: Paid Family Leave Insurance
341.description: Provides circumstances under which family leave benefits may be provided; requires paid family leave insurance policies to specify requirements with regard to covered circumstances; specifies requirements for policies relating to benefit periods, waiting periods, benefit amounts, certain offsets, & payment of benefits; provides that eligibility for family leave benefits may be limited, excluded, or reduced but must be specified in policy; provides paid family leave insurance forms & riders are subject to review by OIR; specifies means by which policy may offer family leave benefits.

342.last_action: Added to Infrastructure & Tourism Appropriations Subcommittee agenda
342.title: Florida National Guard Recruitment
342.description: Establishes Florida National Guard Joint Enlistment Enhancement Program within DMA; provides purpose; provides eligibility requirements; requires Adjutant General to provide compensation to recruiting assistants; requires DMA & Florida National Guard to adopt rules.

343.title: Intravenous Vitamin Treatment
343.description: Requires Board of Nursing to adopt rules establishing procedures to administer certain intravenous treatment & emergency protocols; provides requirements for persons administering such treatment.

344.title: Food Insecure Areas
344.description: Authorizes local government to enact land development regulations to permit land use for small-footprint grocery store located in food insecure area; authorizes local government to include in its comprehensive plan provision permitting land use for small-footprint grocery store located in food insecure area; authorizes local government to require mandatory reporting of information from small-footprint grocery store.

345.title: Local Officials' Employment Contracts
345.description: Provides employment contracts for county administrator & county attorney; chief executive officer of municipality & municipal attorney; and district school superintendent & attorney are not to be renewed, extended, or renegotiated during specified timeframe.

346.title: Local Tax Referenda Requirements
346.description: Requires referendum to reenact expiring tourist development tax or tourist impact tax, respectively, to be held at general election; limits occurrence of such referendum; requires referendum to approve millage rate increase for children's services independent special district property tax to be held at general election; limits occurrence of such referendum; limits occurrence of referendum to approve county or municipal ad valorem tax millage increase, respectively; requires referendum to reenact local government discretionary sales surtax to be held at general election; limits occurrence of such referendum; requires referendum to adopt, amend, or reenact ninth-cent fuel tax or local option fuel taxes, respectively, to be held at general election; limits occurrence of such referendum; removes provisions that authorize school district millage elections to be held at any time & specify limit on such elections; limits occurrence of such referendum.

347.title: Middle School and High School Start Times
347.description: Provides requirements for middle school & high school start times; provides district school board requirements; requires charter schools to meet requirements relating to middle school & high school start times.

348.title: Temporary Teacher Certifications
348.description: Authorizes certain education paraprofessionals to be issued temporary teaching certificate for specified time period; requires such paraprofessionals to be assigned teacher mentor for specified number of school years; revises number of years temporary teaching certificate is valid.

349.last_action: Added to Regulatory Reform & Economic Development Subcommittee agenda
349.title: Secondhand Goods

350.title: Disposal of Food Waste Material
350.description: Directs DEP to conduct study on disposal of food waste materials & submit report to Legislature; provides study requirements.

351.title: Enforcement of School Bus Passing Infractions
351.description: Authorizes school districts to install & operate school bus infraction detection systems & to contract with private vendor or manufacturer; requires school districts to enter into interlocal agreements with law enforcement agencies to enforce violations; requires school district to provide certain notice to public; provides notification requirements & procedures for vendors, manufacturers, & law enforcement agencies; requires person who receives notification of violation to pay civil penalty or request hearing within specified timeframe; provides for distribution & use of funds; specifies requirements of & prohibitions on use of video & images recorded by system; requires reports to DHSMV, Governor, & Legislature; requires SBE to establish system specifications; provides exceptions to penalties for violations enforced by system.

352.last_action: Added to Civil Justice Subcommittee agenda
352.title: Estoppel Letters
352.description: Revises timeframe for mortgagee or mortgage servicer to send estoppel letter; revises requirements for estoppel letter; prohibits mortgagee or mortgage servicer from denying accuracy of estoppel letter; requires payments be applied to unpaid balance of mortgage; provides methods for sending written request for estoppel letter, estoppel letter, & corrected estoppel letter; requires mortgagee or mortgage servicer to take actions within specified time after unpaid balance of loan secured by mortgage has been fully paid; authorizes attorney fees & costs; provides liability.

353.last_action: Now in State Administration & Technology Appropriations Subcommittee
353.title: Emergency Communications
353.description: renames E911 Board as Emergency Communications Board; provides purpose of board; revises composition of board; establishes board responsibilities; requires board to administer fees; authorizes board to establish schedules for implementing wireless systems; establishes notice & publication requirements before distribution of revenues; revises provisions relating to public safety emergency communications systems fee; requires uniform application & imposition of fee; revises factors that board considers when setting percentages or contemplating adjustments to fee; revises emergency communications & 911 service functions; extends date by which Division of Telecommunications within DMS must develop plan to upgrade 911 public safety answering points.

354.title: Property Tax Exemption for Surviving Spouses of Veterans
354.description: Authorizes surviving spouse of veteran who predeceased production of certain letter from Federal Government to produce letter before property appraiser.

355.title: Youth Housing and Employment
355.description: Provides a tax credit to certain businesses that hire homeless youths; provides tax credit to landlords who lease or sell dwelling units under specified conditions recent college graduates; requires Shimberg Center for Affordable Housing to determine certain affordable housing rental needs for certain purposes; requires the State Officer on Homelessness to coordinate with certain entities; requires school districts to allow specified persons access to certain programs.

356.title: Mobile and Manufactured Homes
356.description: Authorizes AG to enforce certain compliance; revises mobile home park owners' obligations; authorizes mobile home park owners & mobile home owners to initiate presuit mediation; revises dispute resolution process; provides requirements for screening prospective purchasers; authorizes courts to award treble damages in certain proceedings; authorizes homeowners' associations to institute, maintain, settle, or appeal certain actions or hearings.

357.title: Sentencing for Trafficking Violations
357.description: Provides for retroactive applicability of specified provisions; requires initial sentencing & resentencing of certain persons who committed certain violations before specified date which involved trafficking in hydrocodone, codeine or oxycodone; provides criminal penalties for such violations that are subject to an initial sentencing or resentencing; specifies procedures.

358.title: Asbestos and Silica Claims
358.description: Requires claimant to file sworn information form containing information within certain time period after filing asbestos or silica claim; authorizes court to dismiss claims upon motion by defendant; provides defendants are not liable for certain asbestos or silica exposures.

359.title: Contracts Entered into by the Department of Children and Families
359.description: Revises requirements for contracts between department & lead agencies.

360.title: Flood Disclosures for Real Property Sales
360.description: Requires seller of real property to disclose in writing certain flood information to prospective purchaser before executing contract for sale of property.

361.last_action: Added to Civil Justice Subcommittee agenda
361.title: Telephone Solicitation
361.description: Prohibits certain telephonic sales calls; provides retroactive applicability.

362.last_action: Now in Local Administration, Federal Affairs & Special Districts Subcommittee
362.title: Disposal of Department of Transportation Property
362.description: Provides that use of property as affordable housing qualifies as use for public purpose in context of authorization of DOT to convey property without consideration to governmental entity.

363.title: Building Permit Applications to Local Governments
363.description: Requires local government to post & update information on its website; requires electronic submission of application; authorizes local government to provide notice of expiration within specified timeframe; prohibits local government from issuing permit unless specified information is included with permit & provided to applicant; revises application process; prohibits local government from requesting additional information from & imposing additional requirements on applicant other than those posted on its website; revises amount by which permit fee must be reduced in certain instances; provides limitation on specified fee.

364.title: Corporate Income Tax
364.description: Specifies circumstances under which corporation is member of unitary combined group; specifies requirements for & prohibitions relating to unitary combined groups; authorizes executive director of DOR to undertake certain actions; revises provisions relating to where sales are considered to occur; specifies requirements for corporate tax return filings; requires recaptured funds be deposited into General Revenue Fund.

365.title: Florida Hometown Hero Housing Program
365.description: Creates Florida Hometown Hero Housing Program to be administered by Florida Housing Finance Corporation; provides purpose of program; specifies requirements for loans under program; authorizes corporation to underwrite & make such loans to specified borrowers; specifies borrowers who are ineligible for program.

366.title: Hernando County School District, Hernando County
366.description: Repeals School Board of Hernando County resolution which provides for appointed superintendent of schools; provides for elected superintendent of schools; requires referendum.

367.title: Shared Parental Responsibility after Establishment of Paternity
367.description: Authorizes parent to request determinations & creation of parenting plan & time-sharing schedule; requires determination of parental responsibility & establishment of parenting plan, time-sharing schedule, or child support to be done through certain action; specifies that mother of child born out of wedlock & father of such child are natural guardians of child & subject to rights & responsibilities of being parents if certain conditions are met.

368.title: Regional Counsel Representation for Child Welfare Matters
368.description: Provides circumstances under which regional counsel may represent indigent parents; requires child protective investigator to provide specified information relating to rights of parent or legal custodian.

369.title: Pregnant Women in Custody
369.description: Requires that every female arrested & not released on bond within 72 hours after arrest be administered pregnancy test within specified timeframe, upon her request; requires that, if pregnant woman is convicted of crime & sentenced to incarceration of any length, sentencing judge provide her opportunity to defer imposed sentence until specified time after delivery; authorizes sentencing judge to order pregnant woman to comply with certain terms & conditions during deferral; requires that woman be offered, & receive upon her request, specified services within 10 days after deferral ends; requires collection & reporting of specified information.

370.title: Driving Under the Influence
370.description: Prohibits trial court from accepting specified pleas when person is charged with DUI offense unless specified conditions are met; revises provisions & penalties regarding first, second, & subsequent refusal to submit to lawful test of breath or urine; authorizes judicial circuits to create Driving Under the Influence Diversion Program; provides program requirements; provides duties of judicial circuits & DHSMV; requires that person's new DUI offense after successful program completion be charged as though person had prior DUI conviction; prohibits court from suspending, deferring, or withholding adjudication of guilt or imposition of sentence for specified violation.

372.last_action: Added to Healthcare Regulation Subcommittee agenda
372.title: Coverage for Skin Cancer Screenings
372.description: Requires individual health insurance policies; group, blanket, & franchise health insurance policies; & health maintenance contracts to provide coverage & payment for annual skin cancer screenings performed by licensed dermatologist without imposing any cost-sharing requirement; specifies requirement for & restriction on payments for such screenings.

373.title: Emergency Medical Services Training Programs
373.description: Revises requirements for application form for institutions applying for program approval for education of emergency medical technicians & paramedics.

374.last_action: Now in Ethics, Elections & Open Government Subcommittee
374.title: Pub. Rec./Employment Accommodations for Family or Household Members of Homicide Victims
374.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for certain information relating to leave requested by employee who has family or household member who is homicide victim; provides for future legislative review & repeal; provides statement of public necessity.

375.last_action: Added to Insurance & Banking Subcommittee agenda
375.title: Taxes on Purchases Made Through Private-label Credit Card Programs
375.description: Removes limitation on maximum amount of tax that can be recovered from certain payments.

376.last_action: Now in State Administration & Technology Appropriations Subcommittee
376.title: Collateral Protection Insurance on Real Property
376.description: Provides calculations of coverages & premiums for collateral protection insurance on real property; prohibits collateral protection insurers & insurance agents from engaging in certain practices; provides requirements for proof of collateral protection insurance; provides requirements for policy forms, certificates of insurance, & rate filings; provides reporting requirements for certain insurers; provides rights & powers to OIR for enforcement purposes; provides requirements for proceedings.

377.last_action: Now in Health & Human Services Committee
377.title: Private Instructional Personnel
377.description: Revises definition of term "private instructional personnel" to include registered behavioral technicians employed by certain providers.

378.last_action: Added to Civil Justice Subcommittee agenda
378.title: Notice of Commencement Requirements
378.description: Requires notice of commencement be in specified form.

379.title: Property Insurance for Wind and Flood
379.description: Requires residential property insurance rate filings to account for windstorm mitigation measures undertaken by policyholders; requires wind uplift prevention to be included in windstorm damage mitigation techniques for residential property insurance rate filings; requires property insurers to verify coverage for peril of flood in certain circumstances; prohibits issuance of coverage for peril of wind in certain circumstances.

380.title: Health Insurance Coverage for Biomarker Testing
380.description: Requires AHCA to pay for biomarker testing under Medicaid program; requires managed care plans to cover biomarker testing under Medicaid program; requires individual health insurance policies, group health insurance policies, health maintenance contracts & prepaid health clinic contracts & health services, health care & health benefit plans to provide coverage for biomarker testing.

381.title: License or Permit to Operate Vehicle for Hire
381.description: Provides person who holds license issued by county, municipality, or airport to operate vehicle for hire may operate vehicle for hire in any other county, municipality, or airport without being subject to certain requirements or fees.

382.title: Retail Fresh Market Farm Stand Signage
382.description: Establishes Fresh From Florida Retail Fresh Market Signage Program & adjunct advisory council within DACS to provide uniform directional signage for certified retail fresh markets; authorizes Commissioner of Agriculture to make certain designations; provides program requirements & fees; requires DOT, upon request, to place signage at specified locations.

383.title: Fees/Retail Fresh Market Farm Stand Signage
383.description: Requires DACS to include specified application, permit, placement, & removal fees in rules implementing Fresh From Florida Retail Fresh Market Signage Program.

384.last_action: Added to Children, Families & Seniors Subcommittee agenda
384.title: Support for Dependent Adult Children
384.description: Creates procedures & requirements for parents, guardians, or guardian advocates of dependent adult children to petition for support; specifies persons to whom support must be paid; authorizes court to assign support to funds on behalf of dependent adult child; prohibits child support order from terminating on child's 18th birthday; revises provisions relating to modification of child support orders & time-sharing; authorizes either parent to consent to mental health treatment of child unless otherwise specified in parenting plan; prohibits child support guidelines from applying to certain cases.

385.title: Ocean City-Wright Fire Control District, Okaloosa County
385.description: Provides for future annexation of certain unincorporated territory.

386.title: Health Education Information
386.description: Requires school districts to ensure information on their website relating to reproductive health & disease education is accurate & up-to-date & send certain notification to parents.

387.title: Verification of Eligibility for a Homestead Exemption
387.description: Requires DOR to establish certain procedures; requires department to adopt rules.

388.title: Renewable Energy Cost Recovery
388.description: Revises types of contracts which are eligible for cost recovery by public utility; authorizes public utility to recover prudently incurred renewable natural gas & hydrogen fuel infrastructure project costs approved by PSC; establishes terms for cost recovery; specifies eligible renewable natural gas & hydrogen fuel infrastructure projects; requires annual report.

389.title: Youth Athletic Activities
389.description: Requires entities that administer or conduct high-risk youth athletic activities or training related to such activities on certain property to require athletics personnel to complete course within specified timeframe & to maintain record of personnel who complete such course for specified timeframe; provides for course requirements; provides exemption.

390.last_action: Added to Justice Appropriations Subcommittee agenda
390.title: Assault or Battery on Hospital Personnel
390.description: Provides for reclassification of certain offenses committed against hospital personnel while engaged in performance of their duties.

391.title: Wastewater Grants
391.description: Authorizes DEP to provide grants for certain projects to restore specified impaired water bodies & water segments.

392.last_action: Added to Health & Human Services Committee agenda
392.title: Operation and Administration of the Baker Act
392.description: Requires DCF to provide specified information to certain individuals & organizations; requires DCF to maintain information handbook & repository of answers to frequently asked questions; provides requirements for such handbook & repository.

393.last_action: Now in Health Care Appropriations Subcommittee
393.title: Medicaid Recipients with Developmental Disabilities
393.description: Requires AHCA to select qualified long-term care plan to implement Integrated Plan for Persons with Developmental Disabilities Pilot Program in Miami-Dade County; provides pilot program purpose; provides benefits covered by pilot program; provides that participation in pilot program is voluntary & limited to specified number of enrollees; provides payment to selected plan; provides requirements for plan; provides requirements for financial reports; provides that plan's pretax income may be subject to certain requirements; requires agency contract for independent evaluation of plan performance; requires presentation of such evaluation results to Legislature by specified date.

394.last_action: Added to Regulatory Reform & Economic Development Subcommittee agenda
394.title: Vacation Rentals
394.description: Revises provisions relating to vacation rentals including taxes collected by advertising platforms; licensing; local registration; information included on advertising platforms.

395.title: Purchase or Acquisition of Real Property and Strategic Assets by People's Republic of China
395.description: Prohibits People's Republic of China from purchasing or acquiring real property & strategic assets in the state.

396.title: Civil Remedies
396.description: Creates rebuttable presumption that lodestar fee is sufficient & reasonable attorney fee in most civil actions; reduces statute of limitations for negligence actions; provides standards for bad faith actions; provides for distribution of proceeds when two or more third-party claims arising out of single occurrence exceed policy limits; limits applicability of provisions relating to attorney fees in certain actions against insurers; provides standards for evidence to prove damages for medical expenses in certain civil actions; requires certain disclosures with respect to claims for medical expenses for treatment rendered under letters of protection; requires trier of fact to consider fault of certain persons who contribute to an injury; provides that owner or principal operator of multifamily residential property which substantially implements specified security measures on that property has presumption against liability in connection with certain criminal acts that occur on premises; revises provisions relating to immunity from liability for injury to trespassers on real property; specifies applicability of provisions relating to offer of judgment & demand for judgment.

397.title: Spaceflight Entity Liability
397.description: Exempts spaceflight entity from liability for injury to or death of crew resulting from inherent risks of spaceflight activities; requires spaceflight entity to have crew sign specified warning statement; revokes immunity privileges for noncompliant spaceflight entity.

398.title: Pub. Rec./Human Trafficking Victim Expunction
