398.description: Provides that petition for human trafficking victim expunction & all pleadings & documents related to petition are confidential & exempt from public records requirements; provides for future legislative review & repeal; provides statement of public necessity.

399.title: Challenges to Development Orders
399.description: Requires prevailing party to show challenge to development order was frivolous before prevailing party is entitled to recover reasonable attorney fees & costs; provides intervenors are not entitled to recover reasonable attorney fees & costs.

400.title: Collegiate Purple Star Campuses
400.description: Requires SBE to adopt rules & BOG to adopt regulations to establish Collegiate Purple Star Campuses program; provides requirements for such program.

401.title: Floating Vessel Platforms and Floating Boat Lifts
401.description: Removes provision authorizing local governments to require permitting for certain floating vessel platforms; revises conditions under which local governments may require one-time registrations of floating vessel platforms.

402.title: Retail Sale of Domestic Dogs and Cats
402.description: Prohibits pet stores from selling or offering for sale domestic dogs & cats; provides penalties.

403.title: Disclosure of Grand Jury Testimony
403.description: Revises list of persons prohibited from disclosing testimony of witness examined before grand jury or evidence it receives; creates exception for request by media or interested person.

404.last_action: Added to Civil Justice Subcommittee agenda
404.title: Translation Services
404.description: Authorizes clerk of circuit court to provide translation services; authorizes clerk to contract with third-party translation service provider to provide such services; requires that such service by clerk be ministerial assistance only; prohibits clerk from providing legal advice.

405.title: Restorative Justice
405.description: Requires DOC to develop & implement training about restorative justice practices; requires notice to victims if restorative justice is available; defines "restorative justice."

406.title: Charter Schools
406.description: Revises provisions relating to charter school charters, governing boards, standard monitoring tool, & charter school capital outlay funding; & authorizes charter schools to issue adjunct teaching certificates.

407.title: Flood Damage Prevention
407.description: Provides specified maximum voluntary freeboard requirements for new construction & substantial improvements to existing construction; prohibits voluntary freeboard from being used in calculation of maximum allowable height for certain construction; authorizes local governments to adopt by ordinance minimum freeboard requirement or maximum voluntary freeboard that exceeds minimum requirements; requires Florida Building Commission to adopt by rule minimum freeboard requirements & to incorporate such requirements into next edition of FBC; requires commission to review freeboard requirements every 5 years.

408.title: Residential Loan Alternative Agreements
408.description: Prohibits residential loan alternative agreement from authorizing person to place lien or other encumbrance on residential real property or from constituting lien, encumbrance, or security interest in such property; prohibits court from enforcing residential loan alternative agreement by lien or constructive trust in residential real property or upon proceeds of disposition of such property; prohibits assignment of residential loan alternative agreement; provides residential loan alternative agreement that does not meet specified requirements is void & unenforceable; prohibits clerk of circuit court from recording residential loan alternative agreement; provides violation is deceptive or unfair trade practice.

409.last_action: Now in Constitutional Rights, Rule of Law & Government Operations Subcommittee
409.title: Holocaust Remembrance Day
409.description: Requires Governor to proclaim January 27 each year as "Holocaust Remembrance Day"; requires such day to be observed in public schools & by public exercises as Governor may designate; requires educational instruction to be provided.

410.title: Public Food Service Establishments
410.description: Revises requirements for certification & training; requires managers & employees to know protocols to avoid cross-contamination; revises provisions regarding approval of food safety training programs & responsibilities of public food service establishments to include all employees; requires operators of public food service establishments to display menu listing common allergens in food & drinks; requires division to develop program for public food service establishments to be designated as food allergy friendly; authorizes division to fine, suspend, or revoke license of public food service establishment.

411.title: Sales Tax Exemption for Renewable Natural Gas Machinery and Equipment
411.description: Provides sales tax exemption for purchase of certain machinery & equipment relating to renewable natural gas; requires purchasers of such machinery & equipment to furnish vendor with certain affidavit; provides exception; provides penalties, including criminal penalty.

412.last_action: Now in State Administration & Technology Appropriations Subcommittee
412.title: Department of Business and Professional Regulation Licensing
412.description: Requires DBPR to certify for licensure qualified individuals who practice mold assessment or mold remediation; revises requirements for issuance of asbestos consultant's license; requires DBPR to certify for licensure by endorsement certain asbestos consultants & asbestos contractors; requires asbestos consultants & asbestos contractors to complete certain courses; requires licensees & licensed agents to provide Division of Hotels & Restaurants with e-mail addresses at which they can be contacted; provides for expiration of public lodging establishment & public food service establishment licenses; requires division to provide forms for license renewals & license applications; revises public lodging establishment & public food service establishment license fees to include option for 2-year renewals; removes requirement limiting types of boxing exhibitions which require specified maximum difference in participant weights.

413.last_action: Added to Healthcare Regulation Subcommittee agenda
413.title: Home Health Care Services Under the Medicaid Program
413.description: Authorizes AHCA to pay for attendant care nursing & private duty nursing services under Medicaid program under certain circumstances; exempts certain home health agencies providing only such services from Medicare certification or its accreditation equivalent.

414.title: Victims of Sexual Violence or Sexual Exploitation
414.description: Provides that victim of sexual violence or sexual exploitation has right to prevent any person or entity from disclosing or disseminating information or records that might identify him or her as victim; prohibits person or entity in possession of certain information or records from disclosing or disseminating such information or records without first obtaining express written consent of victim; authorizes aggrieved person to initiate civil action for injunction against certain persons or entities; provides that aggrieved party who prevails in seeking injunction is entitled to reasonable attorney fees & costs; provides that specified rights may be waived only by express action.

415.title: Dependent Children
415.description: Revises law relating to dependent children including requiring guardians ad litem for each child & attorneys ad litem if court makes certain determinations; authorizes attorneys ad litem to access records, request continuances & receive notices; provides duties & responsibilities of GALs; requiring Statewide Guardian ad Litem Office to provide oversight & assistance to attorneys ad litem, assist child find supportive adult, & designate local DSOs; authorizes Pathway to Prosperity program to provide grants.

416.title: Practice of Audiology and Speech-language Pathology Compact
416.description: Creates Practice of Audiology & Speech-language Pathology Compact; provides for recognition to practice audiology & speech-language pathology, including through telehealth, in member states; provides for development of data system, reporting procedures, & exchange of specified information between member states; specifies licensees practicing in remote state under compact must adhere to laws & rules of that state.

417.title: Pub. Rec. and Meetings/Audiology and Speech-language Pathology Interstate Compact Commission
417.description: Provides exemptions from public meetings & records requirements for Audiology & Speech-language Pathology Interstate Compact Commission & its executive committee; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemptions; provides statements of public necessity.

418.title: My Safe Florida Home Program
418.description: Provides that licensed inspectors are to provide hurricane mitigation inspections on site-built, single-family, residential properties; revises information provided to homeowners as part of hurricane mitigation inspection; revises criteria for mitigation grant eligibility for homeowners; revises amount low-income homeowners may receive from DFS under grant program; removes provision authorizing low-income homeowners to use grant funds for specified purposes; removes provision requiring contracts entered into by DFS to be reviewed & approved by LBC; requires DFS to develop certain quality assurance & reinspection program.

420.title: Authorized Use of Discretionary Sales Surtaxes
420.description: Authorizes certain tax proceeds be used towards specified purposes.

421.title: Fees/Practice of Audiology and Speech-language Pathology Interstate Compact
421.description: Imposes fees for member state compact privilege, annual dues, & annual assessments.

422.last_action: Added to Justice Appropriations Subcommittee agenda
422.title: Theft from Nonprofit Organizations
422.description: Provides for reclassification of theft offenses of specified amounts from nonprofit organizations; requires restitution & community service for certain violations.

423.last_action: Added to PreK-12 Appropriations Subcommittee agenda
423.title: Year-round School Pilot Program
423.description: Creates Year-round School Pilot Program for period of 4 school years beginning with specified school year; provides requirements for program.

425.last_action: Added to Civil Justice Subcommittee agenda
425.title: Labor Pool Act
425.description: Provides labor pool satisfies requirements if its facilities meet minimum requirements in Florida Building Code & any local amendments thereto; requires aggrieved worker to provide specified notice to labor pool before bringing civil action; authorizes labor pool to cure alleged violations; requires civil action be brought within certain time period; provides exclusive remedies.

426.title: Group Health Plans
426.description: Revises definition of & provides requirements for bona fide groups for purposes of issuance of certificates of authority & multiple-employer welfare arrangements.

427.last_action: Bill added to Special Order Calendar (3/30/2023)
427.title: Surrendered Newborn Infants
427.description: Authorizes hospitals, emergency medical services stations, & fire stations to use newborn infant safety devices to accept surrendered newborn infants if device meets specified criteria; requires hospitals, emergency medical services stations, or fire stations to physically check & test devices at specified intervals; authorizes parent to leave newborn infant with medical staff or licensed healthcare professional at hospital after delivery of newborn infant; authorizes parent to surrender newborn infant by calling 911 & requesting EMS provider to meet at specified location to retrieve newborn infant.

428.title: Secured Transactions
428.description: Provides that description of certain accounts & entitlements by certain type of collateral is insufficient for purpose of security agreements.

429.title: Heat Illness Prevention
429.description: Requires certain employers to implement outdoor heat exposure safety program approved by specified agencies; specifies requirements for program; provides responsibilities for certain employers & employees; provides exceptions; requires specified annual training on heat illness & provides requirements for such training.

430.title: Deferred Retirement Option Program Eligibility for School Employees and Personnel
430.description: Removes time limitation for DROP eligibility for certain instructional personnel administrative personnel, & educational support employees.

431.title: Denial of Health Care Services
431.description: Requires covered entity to adopt policy relating to refused services & to submit complete list of refused services to DOH; requires covered entity to submit list, along with its application, if applying for certain state grants or contracts; provides penalty; requires DOH to publish list of covered entities & their refused services on its website; requires DOH to develop & administer public education & awareness program.

432.title: Electronic Filing of Records with the Department of State
432.description: Authorizes DOS to implement password protected system for electronic filing of certain records; provides person using system may be required to verify his or her credentials; authorizes DOS to allow entities to identify authorized account holders; requires DOS to use e-mail addresses as initial authorized account holder & send codes to such e-mail addresses; authorizes DOS to require verification of identities.

433.title: Pub. Rec./E-mail Addresses and Secure Login Credentials/DOS
433.description: Provides exemptions from public records requirements for e-mail addresses collected & held by DOS & secure login credentials held by DOS for certain purpose; provides for retroactive application; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemptions; provides statement of public necessity.

434.title: Charter School Loans
434.description: Establishes Charter School Revolving Loan Program; providing requirements for program, DOE, & third-party administrator; provides appropriation.

435.title: Florida Shared-Use Nonmotorized Trail Network
435.description: Authorizes DEP to establish program to recognize specified local communities as trail towns; revises composition of board of directors of Florida Tourism Industry Marketing Corporation; extends Florida Shared-Use Nonmotorized Trail Network to lands of Florida wildlife corridor; increases amount DOT is required to allocate for purposes of funding & maintaining projects within Florida Shared-Use Nonmotorized Trail Network, etc.

436.title: State Minimum Wage
436.description: Provides that state minimum wage only applies to individuals who are entitled to receive federal minimum wage under federal Fair Labor Standards Act, as amended.

437.last_action: PCS added to Regulatory Reform & Economic Development Subcommittee agenda
437.title: Community Associations
437.description: Requires Division of Florida Condominiums, Timeshares, & Mobile Homes to forward certain complaints to FDLE; requires division to review complaints within specified timeframe & take specified actions; revises provisions relating to homeowners' associations including the governing documents; official records; fines and suspensions; attorney fees and costs; priority of payments; liens; and dispute resolution; authorizes FDLE to investigate certain complaints.

438.title: Fines and Fees
438.description: Authorizes clerk of court to accept monthly installment payments for administrative processing charge; revises methods by which clerk may accept payments for fees, charges, costs & fines; provides requirements for payment plan; authorizes court to modify payment plan or reduce, waive, or convert to community service outstanding fees, costs, or fines; prohibits clerk from sending incarcerated individual's account to collection agency or suspending incarcerated individual's driver license; revises offenses that would lead to suspension of driver license upon failure to comply with court directives.

439.title: Sarasota County
439.description: Creates Town of Siesta Key; provides charter; requires referendum.

440.last_action: Now in Ethics, Elections & Open Government Subcommittee
440.title: District School Board Direct-support Organizations
440.description: Authorizes district school boards to contract with direct-support organizations for personal services or operations; revises amount of expenditures & expenses organization must have to be required to provide for annual financial audit; & authorizes district school boards to contract with vendor for such audits.

442.title: Correctional Facilities
442.description: Prohibits sexual misconduct by any volunteer in, or any employee of contractor or subcontractor of, DOC or private correctional facility; transfers Bureau of Private Prison Monitoring from DMS to DOC; removes provisions relating to powers & duties of DMS concerning private correctional facilities; authorizes DCF to contract with DOC, rather than DMS, for operation of facilities for sexually violent predators; requires DOC to assume specified duties & responsibilities of DMS.

443.title: Postsecondary Educational Institutions
443.description: Revises date by which SBE & BOG must annually compile & publish specified assessments; establishes Committee on Public Policy Events within SUS & requires establishment of specified offices; provides requirements for such committee & offices; designates Florida Student Association as nonprofit advocacy organization for students of SUS & provides requirements; & prohibits public institutions of higher education from requiring completion of political loyalty test or for persons to meet certain qualifications for specified purposes.

444.last_action: Added to Agriculture, Conservation & Resiliency Subcommittee agenda
444.title: Trespassing
444.description: Redefines term "posted land" to include agricultural land that has no trespassing signs placed at specified points.

445.last_action: Added to Constitutional Rights, Rule of Law & Government Operations Subcommittee agenda
445.title: Chiefs of Police
445.description: Provides rights of chiefs of police; requires certain written notice; requires employing agency to cure alleged violation within specified time period; provides exception.

446.title: Temporary Airports
446.description: Requires documentation to be submitted to DOT for temporary airport site approval & registration; requires temporary airport to obtain registration before operation of aircraft; requires DOT to publish notice of receipt of registration application; requires DOT to issue registration concurrent with site approval; provides certain registrations are considered approved; removes condition for licensure or registration; revises exemption for airport used for aerial application or spraying of crops.

447.title: Florida Scholars Academy
447.description: Creates Florida Scholars Academy within DJJ; provides academy's mission; provides for admission of students; requires DJJ to contract for services; provides for appointment of superintendent & trustees; provides powers & duties of board; provides for funding of academy.

448.title: Authorization of Restriction Concerning Dogs
448.description: Authorizes public housing authorities to adopt certain policies relating to dogs; restricts types of ordinances & policies that may be adopted; removes exemption for local breed-specific ordinances adopted before specified date.

449.last_action: Bill added to Special Order Calendar (3/30/2023)
449.title: ACME Improvement District and Pine Tree Water Control District, Palm Beach County
449.description: Transfers certain land from the Pine Tree Water Control District to the Acme Improvement District; provides purpose.

450.title: Jupiter Inlet District, Palm Beach County
450.description: Codifies, amends, reenacts, & repeals special acts relating to Jupiter Inlet District, Palm Beach County; provides purpose & construction.

451.title: Manatee County
451.description: Authorizes Manatee County to construct parking facility & amenities within territorial boundaries of City of Holmes Beach; requires permit for construction to be issued by county.

452.last_action: Now in Local Administration, Federal Affairs & Special Districts Subcommittee
452.title: Operation of a Golf Cart
452.description: Prohibits person from operating golf cart on certain roadways unless he or she possesses valid learner's driver license or valid driver license; provides penalty; removes authority of local governmental entity to enact specified ordinance.

453.title: Defamation
453.description: Provides venue is proper in any county in state for certain defamation causes of action; provides plaintiffs are entitled to reasonable costs & attorney fees; provides person is not public figure for purposes of defamation claim if his or her fame or notoriety arises in specified manner; provides failure to take certain action is evidence of actual malice; revises parties to whom court shall award certain attorney fees & costs.

454.title: Educational Support Employee and Paraprofessional Teacher Certification
454.description: Creates Growing Teachers from Within Pilot Program within DOE; provides purpose for pilot program; requires school districts to apply to department by specified date in order to participate in pilot program; requires Commissioner of Education to select participating school districts based on specified criteria to participate in pilot program; requires commissioner to coordinate with certain state universities; specifies eligibility requirements for participation by school employees in pilot program; requires funding for pilot program to be used in specified manner; requires participating school districts to submit report to commissioner on annual basis; authorizes State Board of Education to adopt rules.

455.title: Fiscal Accountability
455.description: Requires state entities to post certain documents which indicate use of state funds as remuneration under certain contracts on specified system beginning on specified date; removes provision requiring state entities to publish payments on specified website; requires that contracts for services executed, amended, or extended beginning on specified date require contractors to provide specified documentation to be included in state contract tracking system & posted on contractor's website, if applicable.

456.title: State Renewable Energy Goals
456.description: Prohibits drilling or exploration for, or production of, oil, gas, or other petroleum products & permitting & construction of certain related structures; requires statewide renewable energy electricity & carbon emission reductions by specified dates; directs Office of Energy within DACS to develop unified statewide plan; requires office to submit plan & updates to Governor & Legislature; creates Renewable Energy Advisory Committee; directs Commissioner of Agriculture to submit specified annual report to Legislature.

457.last_action: Added to Regulatory Reform & Economic Development Subcommittee agenda
457.title: Dosage Form Animal Health Products
457.description: Requires manufacturers & distributors of dosage form animal health products to register with DACS; provides requirements for registration; provides conditions under which products are considered misbranded or adulterated, respectively.

458.title: Compulsory School Attendance
458.description: Revises required age for compulsory school attendance from 16 to 18 years of age; removes requirement that student's parent sign declaration of intent to terminate school enrollment; removes requirement that school district notify student's parent upon receipt of such declaration; & that adult education high school equivalency programs meet specified attendance requirements.

459.title: HIV Infection Prevention Drugs
459.description: Authorizes certain licensed pharmacists to screen for HIV exposure & order & dispense HIV infection prevention drugs in accordance with certain written supervisory protocol or statewide drug therapy protocol; requires Board of Pharmacy, in consultation with Board of Medicine & Board of Osteopathic Medicine, to adopt rules & develop certain statewide drug therapy protocol.

460.last_action: Added to Infrastructure Strategies Committee agenda
460.title: Driver License, Identification Card, and Motor Vehicle Registration Applications
460.description: Requires motor vehicle registration form & registration renewal form & driver license or ID card application form to include option to make voluntary contribution to Best Buddies International.

461.title: Medicaid Coverage of Continuous Glucose Monitors
461.description: Requires AHCA, subject to availability of funds & certain limitations & directions, to provide coverage for continuous glucose monitors for certain Medicaid recipients; provides requirements for Medicaid recipients to continue receiving coverage for their continuous glucose monitors; requires agency to seek federal approval for implementation of act, if needed; requires agency to include rate impact of act in certain rates that become effective on specified date.

462.title: Economic and Vocational Development
462.description: Extends repeal dates for Florida Development Finance Corporation and Florida Endowment for Vocational Rehabilitation.

463.title: Rescission or Cancellation of a Motor Vehicle Sale
463.description: Requires motor vehicle dealer who rescinds, cancels, or revokes sale or application for title to be reimbursed for tax collected; authorizes dealer, purchaser, & any person claiming lien on motor vehicle to rescind or cancel sale before application for title is submitted; requires DHSMV to rescind, cancel, or revoke title after execution of affidavit; prohibits dealer from offering for retail sale motor vehicle for which sale has been rescinded or canceled until receipt of title from DHSMV.

464.title: Solid Waste Management
464.description: Prohibits municipalities & counties from prohibiting or unreasonably restraining private entities from providing recycling or solid waste management services to certain properties; authorizes municipalities & counties to require such private entities to obtain permits, licenses, or nonexclusive franchise equivalents that meet certain requirements; requires municipalities & counties to apply certain fees to all permit, license, & nonexclusive franchise equivalent holders; provides requirements for contracts or franchises in place as of specified date; authorizes municipalities & counties to impose certain franchise fees.

465.title: Clerks of Court
465.description: Revises collections requirements of clerk of court in petitions for dissolution of marriage, probate matters, & trial & appellate proceedings; revises collections requirements of clerk of court as it relates to fines, fees, service charges & costs remitted to state; authorizes clerk of court to submit request for reimbursement of certain due process costs; provides reimbursement to clerk of court for application for civil indigency; removes provision that excludes additional civil penalty from budget of clerk of court & provisions allowing clerk of court to request reimbursement.

466.last_action: Added to Water Quality, Supply & Treatment Subcommittee agenda
466.title: Deepwater Port Dredging
466.description: Directs DEP to require specified analysis as condition of permits issued for maintenance dredging of deepwater ports; provides requirements for conducting analysis; requires local government to provide specified notice to certain local governments.

467.last_action: Added to Civil Justice Subcommittee agenda
467.title: Value of Motor Vehicles Exempt from Legal Process
467.description: Revises upward value of motor vehicle owned by natural person that is exempt from legal process.

468.title: Wireless Provider Automatic Location Identification Services
468.description: Requires wireless provider to provide automatic location identification of account holder's wireless telephone through emergency number created by provider; specifies format of receipt of automatic location identification information; authorizes certain persons to block for specified timeframe on account holder's ability to access such services; authorizes wireless provider of automatic location identification services to charge specified fee.

469.title: Video Cameras in Certain Public School Classrooms
469.description: Requires video cameras be placed in certain public school classrooms, including charter schools; & provides requirements.

470.last_action: Now in State Administration & Technology Appropriations Subcommittee
470.title: Public Deposits
470.description: Provides requirements for credit unions that are qualified public depositories; provides that public deposits in credit unions by specified trust departments or trust companies are exempt from certain requirements & protection; prohibits CFO from designating credit unions as qualified public depositories unless certain requirements are met; requires CFO to withdraw from specified collateral agreements under certain circumstances; prohibits credit unions from being designated as qualified public depositories if CFO withdraws from collateral agreements; requires specified credit unions to return all public deposits in credit unions within specified timeframe; authorizes CFO to limit amount of public deposits in credit unions for specified purpose; provides requirements for suspension or disqualification of credit unions as qualified public depositories; authorizes CFO to issue cease & desist order & corrective order to credit unions upon certain determinations.

471.last_action: Added to Civil Justice Subcommittee agenda
471.title: Appointment of Courtroom Animal Advocates
471.description: Authorizes court to order separate advocate be appointed in interests of justice for certain civil & criminal proceedings regarding animal's welfare; provides judge's decision denying appointment is not subject to appeal; provides requirements for individual to serve as advocate.

472.title: Defamation, False Light, and Unauthorized Publication of Name or Likenesses
472.description: Provides that journalist's privilege does not apply to defamation claims when defendant is professional journalist or media entity; revises provisions concerning venue for certain actions; provides for attorney fees & costs to prevailing plaintiffs in certain actions; specifies certain persons may not be considered public figures; provides certain allegations are defamatory per se; provides statutory damages to prevailing plaintiffs who are subject of such allegations; creates presumption that statement by anonymous source is presumptively false; provides public figure does not need to show actual malice to prevail in defamation action.

473.title: Juror Sanctions
473.description: Revises available sanctions for any person who is duly summoned to attend court as juror & fails to attend without any sufficient excuse; prohibits court from imposing term of imprisonment on any person who fails to attend as juror without any sufficient excuse & is found in contempt of court unless person is able to obtain legal representation.

474.title: Self-service Storage Facility Liens
474.description: Requires owner of self-service storage space to provide certain notice to alternative contact person; reduces number of times certain advertisement must be published; authorizes such advertisement to be published on certain public websites; reduces amount of time in which sale or other disposition must take place after publication of advertisement; provides requirements for self-service storage space rental agreements & applications for rental agreements.

475.title: Use of Telehealth
475.description: Authorizes telehealth provider to prescribe specified controlled substances for treatment of certain health conditions.

477.last_action: Now in Local Administration, Federal Affairs & Special Districts Subcommittee
477.title: Exemptions for Totally and Permanently Disabled Veterans
477.description: Expands eligibility for certain prorated refund.

478.title: Fill Material for Reclamation Activities
478.description: Requires DEP to approve reclamation and restoration activities on sovereignty submerged lands involving specified fill material.

479.title: Essential Worker Housing Tax Credit
479.description: Creates Essential Worker Housing Tax Credit Program; requires FHFC to administer program; provides credit against specified tax for taxpayers owning interests in eligible essential worker housing developments; requires FHFC to award such credit; provides requirements for credit; prohibits refund of credit; requires FHFC to adopt rules & procedures to monitor compliance.

480.last_action: Added to Children, Families & Seniors Subcommittee agenda
480.title: Children Removed from Caregivers
480.description: Requires community-based care lead agencies to provide trauma-focused assessment to children removed from caregivers; requires such agencies to offer voluntary trauma services to children & their families; requires DCF to require in its contracts with lead agencies that such agencies & managing entities provide trauma-focused assessment to children removed from caregivers.

481.title: Statutorily Required Reports
481.description: Revises procedure for filing statutorily required or authorized reports; requires state entities to redact confidential or confidential & exempt information from reports before filing; requires state entity to retain or archive reports in accordance with certain schedules; requires division to compile bibliographic information on received reports in specified system; requires division to update bibliographic information on quarterly basis; removes provision requiring state entities to create, store, manage, update, retrieve & disseminate statutorily required or authorized reports in electronic format.

482.title: Display of Flags by Governmental Entities
482.description: Provides that certain governmental agencies & units of local government may only display specified flags.

483.title: COVID-19 Mandates and Treatment Options
483.description: Prohibits business entities, governmental entities, & educational institutions from imposing COVID-19 testing, facial covering, & vaccination mandates; prohibits hospitals from interfering with patients' right to choose COVID-19 treatment alternatives; requires health care practitioners to obtain informed consent about COVID-19 treatment options.

484.title: Pub. Rec./COVID-19 Vaccination Mandates
484.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for certain information held by DOH or DLA; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

485.title: Citizens Collaborative Council
485.description: Creates Citizens Collaborative Council within DOC; provides for membership & terms; specifies duties & responsibilities concerning adult correctional facilities; prohibits interference with day-to-day operations of certain facilities.

486.title: Independent Postsecondary Educational Grants
486.description: Authorizes DOE to award grants to students enrolled at certain colleges & universities; provides requirements for such colleges & universities; & provides that such colleges & universities are not under jurisdiction of Commission for Independent Education.

487.title: Child Care and Early Learning Providers
487.description: Revises provisions relating to taxes for preschools & child care providers, licensing, training requirements, screenings, timeframes, insurance, & regulation.

488.title: Town of Southwest Ranches, Broward County
488.description: Prohibits sale & use of fireworks located within Town of Southwest Ranches; provides exception & applicability.

489.title: Government Vehicles
489.description: Revises selection criteria for purchasing or leasing vehicles under state purchasing plan; deletes provision requiring use & procurement of ethanol & biodiesel blended fuels; requires DMS to make recommendations relating to procurement & integration of electric & natural gas fuel vehicles.

490.title: Ave Maria Stewardship Community District, Collier County
490.description: Revises boundaries of Ave Maria Stewardship Community District, Collier County.

491.title: Claims Against Long-term Care Facilities
491.description: Provides requirements for admissible evidence for claim for residents' rights violation or alleged negligence & corroboration of such claim as to each prospective defendant; provides requirements for specified cause of action; provides immunity from liability for certain individuals; prohibits cause of action to be asserted against certain individuals or entities; provides requirements for residents' records; provides for indemnification of facility under certain circumstances.

492.title: Designated Safe Exchange Locations
492.description: Requires court to consider use of safe exchange location when approving, granting, or modifying parenting plan; requires boards of county commissioners to designate certain areas as safe exchange locations; provides requirements for such areas; provides for immunity from liability.

493.title: Reproductive Health Care Rights
493.description: Provides that each person has certain fundamental rights relating to reproductive health care; prohibits person, state, local governmental entity, or any political subdivision of state from discriminating against, denying, unduly burdening, or interfering with person's exercise of such fundamental rights; provides for civil cause of action & remedies; provides that recovery limits of sovereign immunity apply; removes definition of term "fatal fetal abnormality"; revises timeframe in which termination of pregnancy is allowed.

494.last_action: Bill added to Special Order Calendar (3/30/2023)
494.title: Teacher Training and Conduct
494.description: Requires Commissioner of Education to take specified actions relating to classroom teacher training requirements; authorizes classroom teachers to request special magistrate or bring specified action against school district if directed by his or her school district or school to violate general law or rule; provides for award of attorney fees; creates rebuttable presumption in proceedings for teachers & staff members who take specified actions to maintain safety or educational atmosphere; revises provisions relating to student discipline.

495.title: Depositions of Witnesses in Criminal Proceedings
495.description: Prohibits deposition of victims & certain witnesses in certain proceedings without showing of good cause; provides for motions to depose witnesses; provides for factors to be considered concerning such motions; requires written findings.

496.title: Missing Persons
496.description: Revises provisions concerning missing children & adults to include references to National Missing & Unidentified Persons System.

498.title: Medicaid Coverage of Rapid Whole Genome Sequencing
498.description: Requires AHCA, subject to federal approval, to include coverage of rapid whole genome sequencing as separately payable service for certain Medicaid recipients; requires that genetic data generated as result of rapid whole genome sequencing be used only for specified purposes; provides for use of such data in scientific research if patient or his or her legal guardian provides express consent for that use; provides for rescission of such consent; requires entities conducting scientific research, upon receipt of written revocation of consent, to cease use of patient's data & expunge it from any data repositories where it is held; requires agency to seek federal approval to amend current waivers, request new waiver, & amend contracts as necessary for specified purpose; requires agency to adopt rules.

499.title: Certified Peer Specialist Gateway Pilot Program
499.description: Creates pilot program within DOC; provides purposes of pilot program; requires pilot program to offer services at specified facilities; authorizes inmates at participating facilities to apply to participate in pilot program; requires department to develop criteria for selecting applicants; exempts persons who complete pilot program's requirements from specified background screening for peer specialists; requires pilot program to assist potential employers with acquiring specified bonds; authorizes pilot program to offer funding to potential employer to cover specified costs; requires department to adopt rules; provides for expiration of pilot program; provides appropriation.

500.title: Offenses Against Certain Animals
500.description: Prohibits offering or doing violence to police horse or police canine in certain circumstances; increases classification of specified criminal offenses committed against police canines, fire canines, SAR canines, or police horses.

501.title: Boca Raton Airport Authority, Palm Beach County
501.description: Provides boundaries; provides authority is independent special district; provides for title of land to be vested in authority; provides additional powers & duties; provides attendance fee for members; requires Board of Trustees of Internal Improvement Trust Fund to transfer title of land to authority; revises employment of airport manager; provides authority is political subdivision of state for sovereign immunity purposes.

502.title: Use and Access of Public Restrooms
502.description: Revises prohibited acts in public bathroom facilities; prohibits public food service establishment & certain businesses barring certain individuals from using public bathroom facilities; prohibits public food service establishment & certain businesses from posting certain signs to prevent certain individuals from accessing public bathroom.

503.title: Organ Donation
503.description: Requires DOH to adopt rules to streamline medical testing & transfer medical records for certain entities within specified time frame.

504.title: Third-party Credentialing Entities
504.description: Provides review & appeal process for decisions made by third-party credentialing entity.

505.title: Scholarships and Loan Forgiveness for Mental Health Professionals
505.description: Establishes mental health profession scholarship & loan forgiveness program within DOH for specified purpose; provides for applicant eligibility & award of scholarships; limits number of scholarship awards that may be granted each year; specifies service obligations for scholarship recipients; provides for repayment of scholarship funds if program requirements are not fully satisfied; provides for applicant eligibility & award of loan repayments; specifies conditions for award of such loan repayments; requires department to review loan repayment applicant requests on quarterly basis & grant awards in specified manner.

506.title: Mammography Reports
506.description: Extends repeal of provisions requiring facilities that perform mammography to send patients certain summary of their mammography report.

507.title: Animal Cremation
507.description: Requires provider of companion animal cremation services to provide certain written description of services & include certification with cremated remains; requires referring persons or entities to provide copies of such written descriptions; provides for collection and deposit of civil penalties; provides circumstances under which person commits unfair or deceptive act or engages in unfair method of competition; provides for private right of action; authorizes DACS to take certain actions & adopt rules.

508.title: Health Insurance Cost Sharing
508.description: Requiring specified individual health insurers and their pharmacy benefit managers to apply payments by or on behalf of insureds toward the total contributions of the insureds' cost-sharing requirements; requiring specified contracts to require pharmacy benefit managers to apply payments by or on behalf of insureds toward the insureds' total contributions to cost-sharing requirements; requiring specified group health insurers and their pharmacy benefit managers to apply payments by or on behalf of insureds toward the total contributions of the insureds' cost-sharing requirements; requiring specified contracts to require pharmacy benefit managers to apply payments by or on behalf of insureds toward the insureds' total contributions to cost-sharing requirements, etc.

509.title: Protections for Public Employees who Use Medical Marijuana as Qualified Patients
509.description: Prohibits public employer from taking adverse personnel action against employee or job applicant who is qualified patient for his or her use of medical marijuana; provides exceptions; requires public employer to provide written notice of employee's or job applicant's right to explain positive marijuana test result within specified timeframe; provides procedures that apply when public employee or job applicant tests positive for marijuana; provides cause of action & damages.

510.last_action: Now in Health & Human Services Committee
510.title: Autonomous Practice by an Advanced Practice Registered Nurse
510.description: Revises staff membership & clinical privileges for advanced practice registered nurses; revises practice requirements for autonomous advanced practice registered nurse; revises practice requirements for certified nurse midwifes; authorizes autonomous advanced practice registered nurse to perform certain acts; provides for expiration of Council on Advanced Practice Registered Nurse Autonomous Practice.

512.last_action: Now in Local Administration, Federal Affairs & Special Districts Subcommittee
512.title: Drone Delivery Services
512.description: Prohibits political subdivision from taking certain actions against drone delivery service based on location of its drone port; exempts drone ports from Florida Building Code & Florida Fire Prevention Code.

513.title: Missing Child Identification
513.description: Creates Missing Child Identification Program to be administered by AG; requires AG to provide DOE with certain identification kits; requires DOE to distribute identification kits to all public & charter schools; requires each public & charter school to provide identification kit to parent or person who has legal custody of child enrolled in kindergarten at school upon request; authorizes parent or legal guardian to submit identification kit to certain law enforcement agencies.

514.title: Divine Nine Specialty License Plate
514.description: Revises eligibility requirements for Divine Nine license plate.

515.title: Recognition of Chiropractic Accrediting Entities
515.description: Replacing references to "the Council of Chiropractic Education" with "an accrediting agency recognized by U.S. DOE" for accreditation purposes.

516.title: Saltwater Intrusion Vulnerability Assessments
516.description: Authorizes DEP to provide grants to coastal counties for saltwater intrusion vulnerability assessments; requires DEP to update comprehensive statewide flood vulnerability & sea level rise data, post certain assessment information on website, & provide cost-share funding for grants; exempts certain counties from cost-share funding.

517.title: Contraband Forfeiture
517.description: Requires stay of proceedings subsequent to probable cause finding for forfeiture; requires stay of forfeiture until final disposition of associated criminal charges or while prosecuting agency determines whether charges will be filed; requires written notice of such charges to court; requires conviction in associated criminal offense for forfeiture; requires return of seized property if all associated criminal charges are dismissed or prosecuting agency declines to file; prohibits agencies from transferring property seized under state law to federal agency for specified purpose.

519.last_action: Added to Infrastructure & Tourism Appropriations Subcommittee agenda
519.title: Department of Highway Safety and Motor Vehicles
519.description: Revises provisions relating to powers & duties of DHSMV; licenses & fuel tax decals; crash reports; motor vehicle air pollution control equipment; owners & drivers of commercial motor vehicles; certificates of title; transfer of ownership of motor vehicles or mobile homes; damaged or dismantled vessels; registration of rental trucks; license plates; enforcement of federal provisions; driver licenses and ID cards of sexual offenders and sexual predators; Commercial Driver's License Drug & Alcohol Clearinghouse; & noncancelable motor vehicle insurance.

520.title: Child Support
520.description: Authorizes deferral of support payments for obligor's good faith job training efforts; revises & provides child support requirements relating to depository, clerks of circuit court, fees, DCF, & State Disbursement Unit; removes exceptions relating to incarceration when establishing or modifying support order; authorizes child's caregiver to provide affidavit or written declaration regarding putative father.

521.title: Multilingual Versions of Statewide Standardized Assessments
521.description: Requires DOE to develop & school districts to administer multilingual versions of certain statewide, standardized assessments in specified home languages to certain students who are or were English language learners; defines "multilingual version of assessment"; authorizes parents of eligible students to request monolingual version such assessments for his or her student; requires department to develop timetable & action plan to phase in administration of such assessments.

522.title: Licensing Fee Relief
522.description: Waives portion of initial license application fee & renewal fees for certain licenses; provides maximum waiver; provides expiration.

523.title: Sales Tax on Motor Vehicle Leases and Rentals
523.description: Provides that sales tax does not apply to certain leases or rentals of motor vehicles.

524.title: Mental Health and Substance Abuse
524.description: Revises requirement for DCF relating to performance outcomes & measures; requires managing entities to lead implementation of coordinated system of care; removes provisions relating to contracts for provision of local substance abuse & mental health programs, state & district substance abuse & mental health plans, & financing of district programs & services; revises managing entity duties; removes requirement for certain managing entities to enter into memoranda of understanding relating to network accreditation & systems coordination.

525.title: Disclosure of Estimated Property Taxes
525.description: Requires residential property listings to include specified information; requires DOR to develop specified formula; requires property appraisers to annually provide certain information to DOR; requires DOR to annually publish information on its website; provides affirmative defense.

526.title: Adoption
526.description: Revises provisions relating to adoption, including requirements for DCF, adoption entities, unmarried biological fathers, & clerks of court; consents to adoption; motions to intervene in dependency proceedings; transfer of custody of child; notice requirements; & termination of parental rights.

527.last_action: Added to Children, Families & Seniors Subcommittee agenda
527.title: Education for Children and Young Adults in Out-of-home Care
527.description: Requires DCF to work with stakeholders to educate children & young adults in out-of-home care regarding their rights, protections & benefits; provides roles, responsibilities & requirements of DCF, requires DCF to establish Office of Ombudsperson; provides duties of office; authorizes office to access certain records & work with certain individuals & agencies; requires office to submit annual report to Legislature & DCF & post report on its website.

528.last_action: Added to Agriculture, Conservation & Resiliency Subcommittee agenda
528.title: Boating-restricted Areas
528.description: Authorizes counties & municipalities to establish within certain portions of Florida Intracoastal Waterway slow speed, minimum wake boating-restricted areas within specified distance from private or public marina pumpouts.

529.last_action: Added to Justice Appropriations Subcommittee agenda
529.title: Rapid DNA Grant Program
529.description: Creates Rapid DNA Grant Program within FDLE for county jails or sheriffs' offices; requires department to annually award grant funds to county jails or sheriffs' offices; provides funding requirements; authorizes department to establish criteria & set specific time periods for acceptance of applications & selection process for awarding grant funds.

530.title: Continuing Chiropractic Education
530.description: Removes requirement chiropractic continuing education be completed in classroom setting; prohibits board from limiting number of hours of continuing education courses chiropractic physician may complete through distance learning; authorizes board to make exceptions to meet continuing education requirements during declared state of emergency; specifies who may teach board-approved continuing education courses.

531.title: Substitution of Work Experience for Postsecondary Education Requirements
531.description: Provides requirements for hiring considerations by public employers; provides postsecondary degree may be baseline requirement; authorizes applicant to appeal hiring consideration; provides remedies if DMS substantiates appeal or report; authorizes agency to elect to substitute work experience for postsecondary educational requirements for person seeking to enter into contract with agency.

532.title: Value-added Insurance Products
532.description: Provides that certain restrictions against unfair discrimination & unlawful rebates do not include value-added products & services offered & provided by insurers & agents if certain conditions are met; provides requirements for & restrictions on insurers & agents offering & providing such products & services; authorizes insurers & agents to provide such products & services as part of pilot & testing program.

533.title: Palm Beach County
533.description: Creates Village of Loxahatchee; provides charter, requires referendum.

534.last_action: Added to Choice & Innovation Subcommittee agenda
534.title: Florida Education Finance Program
534.description: Revises requirements for calculation of additional FTE membership based on IB examination scores of students to include students who earn specified grades in certain IB courses; provides additional bonus to teachers whose students earn specified grades in such courses.

535.title: Medical Treatment of Animals
535.description: Authorizes certain veterinarians to practice veterinary telemedicine; provides jurisdiction of Board of Veterinary Medicine; authorizes veterinarian practicing telemedicine to order, prescribe, or make available specified medicinal drugs; prohibits such veterinarian from ordering, prescribing, or making available controlled substances unless certain conditions are met; revises grounds for disciplinary action against veterinarian; authorizes certain employees, agents, or contractors to administer rabies vaccinations; provides that supervising veterinarian assumes responsibility for any person working under veterinarian's supervision or at his or her direction; authorizes veterinarian who indirectly supervises administration of rabies vaccination to affix his or her signature stamp in lieu of actual signature on rabies vaccination certificate.

536.last_action: Now in Health & Human Services Committee
536.title: Withholding or Withdrawal of Life-prolonging Procedures
536.description: Authorizes court to delegate right to consent to withholding or withdrawal of life-prolonging procedures of incapacitated persons in certain circumstances; provides requirements for initial & annual guardianship plans; establishes certain authority without additional court approval; requires court approval for decisions to withhold or withdraw life-prolonging procedures; specifies procedures that must be followed by court in acting on petition; provides exceptions.

537.title: Florida Retirement System
537.description: Authorizes employers to establish volunteer programs; establishes criteria for such programs.

538.title: Commercial Service Airport Transparency and Accountability
538.description: Revises information required to be posted on website of governing body; requires commercial service airport to use specified competitive solicitation processes for certain purchases of commodities or contractual services; revises type of contract governing body must approve, award, or ratify as separate line item on agenda; requires governing body to provide opportunity for public comment on certain contracts; prohibits certain contracts from being approved, awarded, or ratified as part of consent agenda.

539.title: Interstate Education Compacts
539.description: Creates Interstate Teacher Mobility Compact for the purpose of authorizing teachers licensed in one member state to become licensed in another member state; provides requirements for such compact; & revises cross-references in Interstate compact on Educational Opportunity for Military Children.

540.last_action: Now in Ethics, Elections & Open Government Subcommittee
540.title: Pub. Rec. and Meetings/Interstate Teacher Mobility Compact
540.description: Provides exemptions from public meetings & records requirements for Interstate Teacher Mobility Compact Commission & its executive committee; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemptions; provides statements of public necessity.

541.title: Roller Skating Rink Safety
541.description: Provides operator of roller skating rink is not liable for damages or personal injury resulting from inherent risks of roller skating; provides exceptions; provides persons assume inherent risk of roller skating; provides operator is not required to eliminate, alter, or control inherent risks in roller skating; establishes responsibilities of roller skaters; provides failure to comply with such responsibilities constitutes negligence.

542.title: Property Tax Administration
542.description: Revises provisions relating to appeals by property appraisers; recalculations of assessments based on errors; assessment of newly discovered changes, additions & improvements; back taxes; appeals to value adjustment board & variance minimums for appeals.

543.last_action: Now in Health & Human Services Committee
543.title: Physician Assistant Licensure
543.description: Revises requirements for applicant for licensure as physician assistant.

544.title: Nitazene Derivatives
544.description: Lists certain nitazene derivatives in schedule I of schedule of controlled substances.

545.title: State Board of Administration
545.description: Specifies when SBA may not pay certain benefits; authorizes SBA to develop investment products; modifies procedures for designation of beneficiaries; revises investments which SBA may make; authorizes SBA & affiliated entities to issue securities, borrow moneys & use proceeds of loans or financing obligations as loans or sources of funding; revises types of funds in which state may invest; revises amount of funds which may be invested in alternative investments.

546.title: Resolution of Disputed Property Insurance Claims
546.description: Requires, rather than authorizes, parties to property insurance claims dispute to participate in mediation; provides that mediation is condition precedent to commencing litigation; provides that parties may mutually agree to conduct mediation by teleconference or by telephone; requires all insureds to personally attend mediation; revises & specifies duties as to bearing certain costs of mediation; requires, rather than authorizes, DFS to adopt certain rules; authorizes department to adopt certain emergency rules; requires policyholder to provide insurer with certain documents after mediation is invoked; revises conditions under which policyholder has certain timeframe to rescind settlement.

547.last_action: Added to Civil Justice Subcommittee agenda
547.title: Immunity of Motor Vehicle Dealer Leasing and Rental Affiliates
547.description: Defines "motor vehicle dealer's leasing or rental affiliate" to specify entities that are immune from causes of action & that are not liable for harm to persons & property; defines "control."

548.last_action: PCS added to Healthcare Regulation Subcommittee agenda
548.title: Foreign-licensed Physicians
548.description: Provides for provisional licenses by endorsement for certain foreign-licensed physicians; provides applicant requirements; provides powers and duties of DOH and Board of Medicine; authorizes board to adopt rules.

549.title: Resilience Districts
549.description: Authorizes establishment of infrastructure resilience districts & condominium resilience districts; provides requirements related to establishment of such districts, including petitions, public hearings, resolutions, size, boards, & budgets; requires resilience districts to replace certain other special taxing districts; specifies acceptable uses of resilience districts for infrastructure & condominiums; authorizes payment of fees for project management of infrastructure resilience district.

550.title: Carbon Sequestration
550.description: Requires DACS to conduct study on carbon sequestration activities & programs & submit report to Legislature by specified date; provides appropriation.

551.title: Financial Improvements to Real Property
551.description: authorizes residential or commercial property owner to apply to local government to enter into financing agreement with local government; specifies requirements of financing agreement for government commercial property; specifies determinations local government must make before entering into financing agreement for commercial properties; restricting what improvements may be covered in certain agreements between local governments & commercial property owners; specifies requirements for local government before entering into financing agreement; revises notice requirements regarding owner's intent to enter into financing agreement; revises seller's disclosure statement for commercial properties offered for sale.

552.title: Communications Services Tax
552.description: Decreases tax rate on retail sale of communication services; revises name of the discretionary communications services tax; requires certain tax remain the same rate; prohibits certain tax from being added to the local communications service tax.

553.title: Provisional Child Care Licensing
553.description: Requires local licensing agency or DCF to issue provisional license or registration for family day care home.

554.title: Contractual Services Contract Liability Limits
554.description: Requires certain contract documents to include specified provision that provides certain liability limits.

555.last_action: Added to Infrastructure Strategies Committee agenda
555.title: Venomous Reptiles
555.description: Revises penalty for certain release or escape of venomous reptiles; provides penalty for specified activities involving venomous reptiles without special permit or license issued by FWCC.

556.title: Dental Licensure Examinations and Regulations
556.description: Revises licensure examination requirements for dentists; revises reexamination & continuing education requirements; removes provision relating to dentist specialties.

557.title: Premises Liability for Criminal Acts of Third Parties
557.description: Requires trier of fact to consider comparative fault of certain persons in certain actions for damages; provides owner or operator of multifamily complex with presumption against liability under certain circumstances; specifies safety & security measures that must be implemented to gain presumption; provides that such owners or operators do not lose presumption under certain circumstances.

558.title: Mitigation Credits
558.description: Authorizes DEP & water management districts to release mitigation credits to certain mitigation banks under specified conditions & to authorize use of mitigation credits available within surrounding basins or within specified regions; provides circumstances under which mitigation credits are deemed unavailable in basin; requires affidavits from mitigation banks before certain mitigation credits are released; authorizes certain projects to use mitigation banks regardless of whether they are located within mitigation service area; requires DEP to begin rulemaking by specified date.

559.last_action: Bill added to Special Order Calendar (3/30/2023)
559.title: Hamilton County
559.description: Creates Hamilton County Development Authority; provides for appointment & terms of members of board of authority; provides powers; provides for annual budget & annual financial reporting; limits authority to incur debt; provides purpose & construction; provides for severability.

560.title: Lake County
560.description: Provides purpose for Rural Protection Areas in Lake County; creates Wekiva-Ocala Rural Protection Area, Emeralda Marsh Rural Protection Area, & Yalaha-Lake Apopka Rural Protection Area; provides boundaries; provides maximum densities; provides exceptions to maximum densities.

561.title: Collier Mosquito Control District, Collier County

563.title: Dental Care
563.description: Authorizes Medicaid reimbursement for dental services provided by mobile dental units owned by, operated by, or having contractual agreements with specified entities; revises licensure examination requirements for dental hygienists to authorize applicants to demonstrate certain clinical skills on live patient rather than only on manikin; authorizes Board of Dentistry to require persons applying to take dental hygiene examination to maintain medical malpractice insurance in certain amounts.

564.title: Pub. Rec./Veterans Employment and Training Services Program
564.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for certain materials received, generated, ascertained, or discovered by Florida Is For Veterans, Inc., for purposes of administering Veterans Employment & Training Services Program; provides exception; provides for future legislative review & repeal; provides statement of public necessity.

565.title: Seagrass Restoration
565.description: Establishes Seagrass Restoration Technology Development Initiative within DEP; requires creation of 10-year Florida Seagrass Restoration Plan; requires initiative to submit annual report by specified date to Governor, Legislature, Secretary of Environmental Protection, & executive director of FWCC; establishes Initiative Technology Advisory Council as part of initiative; provides for meetings, membership, terms of office, & compensation of advisory council; provides for expiration of initiative; provides appropriation.

566.title: Review of Compensation for Legislators and Cabinet Members
566.description: Requires OPPAGA to conduct research, analyze data, & prepare reports containing certain information; requires such reports to be provided to Governor & Legislature; provides requirements for reports.

567.last_action: Reported out of Insurance & Banking Subcommittee
567.title: Consumer Protection
567.description: Provides additional requirements for distributed energy systems; specifies violations for which department may penalize licensees; prohibits certain contracts by public adjusters; provides an additional requirement for public adjusters license; specifies additional conduct that constitutes unfair methods of competition & unfair or deceptive acts or practices; revises provisions relating to hurricane deductibles; reduces period in which an insurer may cancel property insurance policy in certain circumstances; revises duties of insurers & agents concerning sale of annuities; provides training & education requirements for agents; provides additional requires for service agreement policy.

568.title: Campaign Finance
568.description: Prohibits political committee from transferring funds to another political committee; revises definition of term "contribution."

569.last_action: Now in State Administration & Technology Appropriations Subcommittee
569.title: Monuments
569.description: Establishes Florida Space Exploration Monument; provides for administration of monument by DMS; provides for creation of design contest & selection committee; requires department to develop plan for design, placement, & cost of monument; requires plan to be submitted to Governor & Legislature; requires DMS to limit participation in design competitions for monuments on Capitol Complex or at other state-owned buildings to sculptors & artists who are domiciled in this state.

570.last_action: Added to Infrastructure & Tourism Appropriations Subcommittee agenda
570.title: Use of Phosphogypsum
570.description: Authorizes DOT to undertake demonstration projects using phosphogypsum in road construction aggregate material; requires DOT to conduct study on phosphogypsum as construction aggregate material; provides that phosphogypsum used under specified circumstances is not solid waste & is allowed use in state; authorizes placement of phosphogypsum in specified stack systems.

571.title: Corporate Practice of Medicine
571.description: Provides additional acts that constitute grounds for denial of license or disciplinary action to which penalties apply.

573.title: Land and Water Management
573.description: Prohibits counties & municipalities from adopting laws, regulations, rules, or policies relating to water quality or quantity, pollution control, discharge prevention or removal, or wetlands & preempts such regulation to the state; requires DEP to notify CFO of certain violations; requires CFO to withhold certain funds; repeals provisions relating to land management review teams.

574.title: Medicaid Eligibility for Young Adults
574.description: Requires AHCA, in consultation with Commission on Mental Health & Substance Abuse, to conduct study for specified purpose; provides requirements for study; provides duties for agency based on findings in study; requires agency to submit report of findings & recommendations to Governor & Legislature by specified date.

576.title: Registrations and Transfers of Heating, Ventilation, and Air-Conditioning System Manufacturer Warranties
576.description: Requires manufacturer warranty for HVAC system to run with property; provides that warrantor continues to be obligated under terms of manufacturer warranty agreement for warranty transferred to new owner & may not charge transfer fee; provides that transfer of warranty to new owner does not extend warranty; provides warranty is deemed registered if contractor meets certain requirements.

577.title: Advertisement for Legal Services
577.description: Prohibits use of certain phrases, logos, & terms in advertisements for legal services; requires advertisements for legal services relating to injuries from medications or medical devices to include specified statements & information; prohibits protected health information from being sold, transferred, disclosed, used, or obtained without written authorization; provides violations are deceptive & unfair trade practices & violators are subject to specified penalties & remedies.

578.title: Operation New Hope
578.description: Authorizes DOC to contract with Operation New Hope for specified services.

579.last_action: PCS added to Regulatory Reform & Economic Development Subcommittee agenda
579.title: Department of Economic Opportunity
579.description: Requires Secretary of Economic Opportunity to appoint deputy secretaries & directors for specified divisions of DEO; exempts loans made with funds administered by DEO from certain taxes; revises eligibility requirements for certain grants awarded by DEO; removes scheduled repeal of Florida Development Finance Corporation; revises membership of board of directors of Space Florida; revises areas in which DEO may provide grants through Everglades Restoration Agricultural Community Employment Training Program.

580.title: Child Restraint Requirements
580.description: Revises requirements for use of crash-tested, federally approved child restraint device while transporting child in motor vehicle.

581.title: Assistant State Attorney and Assistant Public Defender Student Loan Repayment Program
581.description: Establishes program within DOE; provides purpose of program; requires DOE to administer program; provides eligibility requirements; provides procedures for payments; provides payments are not considered taxable income; requires DOE to reduce payments for all program participants by proportional amount if appropriated funds are insufficient to provide maximum payment for all participants' loans.

582.title: Pub. Rec./Inspectors and Investigators/DACS
582.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for personal identifying & location information of current or former inspectors or investigators of DACS & spouses & children of current or former inspectors or investigators; provides for retroactive application; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

583.title: Energy Regulation
583.description: Requires determinations on building new energy generating facilities to take certain factors into consideration; prohibits local governmental entities from requiring or prohibiting certain building materials, vehicles, or home heating elements; authorizes local governmental entities to adopt bid specifications for public works projects that take energy savings or production into consideration; prohibits adoption or enforcement of certain state & regional programs to regulate greenhouse gas emissions without specific legislative authorization.

584.title: State-Operated Institutions Inmate Welfare Trust Fund
584.description: Specifies which funds should receive revenue from specified sources; revises maximum annual amount that may be deposited into State-Operated Institutions Inmate Welfare Trust Fund; adds environmental health upgrades to DOC facilities & fixed capital outlay for educational facilities as permissible uses for funds; revises disposition of inmate copayments for health care.

585.last_action: Now in State Administration & Technology Appropriations Subcommittee
585.title: Broadband Internet Service Providers
585.description: Authorizes rural electric cooperatives to provide communications services for purpose of expanding broadband Internet service to unserved areas of this state.

586.title: Public PreK-12 Educational Institution and Instruction Requirements
586.description: Requires specified policies relating to person's sex at public K-12 educational institutions; prohibits specified actions relating to use of certain titles & pronouns; & revises requirements for instruction on sexual orientation & gender identity in public schools.

587.title: Sanford Airport Authority, Seminole County
587.description: Revises authorized term for which authority may enter into exclusive or nonexclusive contracts, leases, franchises, or other arrangements with any person.

588.last_action: Added to Justice Appropriations Subcommittee agenda
588.title: Problem-solving Courts
588.description: Revises requirements for data & information collection & reporting; revises admission requirements for pretrial substance abuse education & treatment intervention programs & misdemeanor pretrial substance abuse education & treatment intervention programs.

589.title: Endangered and Threatened Species
589.description: directs FWCC to protect endangered or threatened species, regardless of status of their federal classification; revises criteria for placement of species on Regulated Plant Index by DACS; directs department, in consultation with Endangered Plant Advisory Council, to protect certain endangered or threatened species, reenacts laws relating to site-specific location information for endangered & threatened species & prohibitions relating to Florida panther.

590.title: End-of-life Options
590.description: Establishes procedure to allow adult who has mental capacity & who has terminal condition & who makes fully informed decision that he or she no longer wants to live, to obtain medication to end his or her life; provides requirements for health care providers, health care facilities & DOH.

591.title: Drug-enhancement Zones
591.description: Revises or eliminates certain drug-enhancement zones.

592.title: Restoration of Voting Rights
592.description: Requires Florida Commission on Offender Review to develop & maintain database containing certain information for certain purpose; requires certain governmental entities to provide certain information to commission; requires DMS, acting through Florida Digital Service, to provide certain technical assistance to commission; requires commission to make database available to public on Internet website by certain date; requires commission to update database monthly & publish certain information on website; requires commission to provide comprehensive plan to Governor & Legislature by certain date; provides that person who takes certain actions in reasonable reliance on database may not be charged with certain violations of criminal law.

593.title: North River Fire District, Manatee County
593.description: Specifies real property not subject to special assessments in North River Fire District, Manatee County.

594.last_action: Now in Local Administration, Federal Affairs & Special Districts Subcommittee
594.title: United States-produced Iron and Steel in Public Works Projects
594.description: Requires governmental entities to include requirement in certain contracts that certain iron or steel products must be produced in United States; provides exceptions; authorizes use of foreign steel & iron materials in certain circumstances; requires DMS & DOT to adopt rules.

595.last_action: Added to Regulatory Reform & Economic Development Subcommittee agenda
595.title: Safety Standards for Amusement Rides
595.description: Revises and creates amusement ride provisions relating to certification reports; permit applications; temporary ride exemptions; nondestructive testing; inspections standards; unannounced inspections & reports; confidential & exempt information; active investigations; reporting for accidents involving medical treatment; impoundment of rides; DACS rules; & employee training.

596.last_action: Added to Regulatory Reform & Economic Development Subcommittee agenda
596.title: Pub. Recs./Safety Standards for Amusement Rides
596.description: Provides exemption from public records requirements for all investigatory records made or received by DACS pursuant to active amusement ride investigation for specified timeframe; provides for future legislative review & repeal of exemption; provides statement of public necessity.

597.title: Florida Kidcare Program Income Eligibility
